Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Impeccable service AND Amazing Rates!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley M
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal for business, and having Great service combined with affordable rates is nearly unheard of! Not at the Figueroa - first, the Location is perfect; whether on business or leisure you are close to all that downtown L.A. has to offer. I was able to walk everywhere. The service at "The Fig" was impeccable; from check-in to the lounge, you are treated like a VIP guest. The rates are so affordable, I couldn't believe it, especially for the very unique rooms! I loved the Lobby and the Pool/Jacuzzi area and the lounge was so awesome - it made you feel like you were in morocco and not in downtown L.A. I will be back to this wonderful hotel! I also HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Los Angeles!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most unique and charming hotels I've ever seen...”
Reviews.Author: Cherie S
Reviews.Content: We just spent our anniversary weekend at the Figueroa Hotel...and what a wonderful experience it was! The pictures online do not do this hotel justice...as soon as you see it you immediately feel the history associated with it! The decor is amazing...and everything is just beautiful! The pool/jacuzzi area is an oasis in the middle of downtown! So relaxing to sit out there around the beautiful plants, flowers and birds while sipping a cocktail. The staff was attentive, polite and very helpful. A VERY special thank you to Uno for making sure we had such a great room! The walls, the ceilings...all of the decor was an experience in itself. It was a special experience to be inside the room looking out at all the huge modern buildings including the Staples Center while at the same time being inside a room with such history and charm! I highly recommend staying with Uno and his wonderful group of employees at the Fig...it is an experience you will remember and in our case cherish! You can stay at a Marriott or a Hilton no matter WHERE you travel...you will be hard pressed to find a hotel with such charm and personality at this hotel anywhere. Thank you again Uno...and everyone at the Hotel Figueroa for making us feel so welcome and being a part of a very special weekend for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “They ruined my pants”
Reviews.Author: JPH007
Reviews.Content: I was in LA just for one night to see a play and to take care of some work business the following morning. They did not have an iron/ironing board in the room. When I called down for one, it was brought to me pretty promptly. But the iron had some sort of burnt "stuff" on it and the second it touched the only pair of pants I brought, it ruined them! I called down to the lobby and told them what happened and all they did was get me a new iron. No apology... nothing! So I went down to the front desk to talk about what happened, and again I did not get an apology. I was just told that there was a Macy's 6 blocks away if I wanted to buy new pants... which I had to. They also did not offer to reimburse me for the new pants that I had to buy. I work for a company that owns hotels and a resort, and service is everything. The Figueroa may look like a unigue hip hotel, but it has the service of a run down motel in the middle of no where. We stay in LA for work/pleasure at least once a month and I will never stay here again. PS The beds were not very comfortable and the bedding was rough and sctratchy. I can sleep anywhere, but if you need super comfort... this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic and Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Moorestowners
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful four day stay at "La Fig" as it is known (and admired) locally. Tom the exquisite service to the hospitality of the hotelier, it was a most enjoyable stay. The setting is tres chic in that Uno Thimansson is a most congenial host and the room was so much fun to call home for a few days. Staff were attentive and met every need. The jacuzzi was a treat in the midst of a great collection of plants and the pool area is perfectly situated. The hotel is in the Heart! of the action for the Staples Center and the Convention Center. You MUST stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be staying at the Fig every chance I get.”
Reviews.Author: dcj8
Reviews.Content: I've had the opportunity to stay at the Figueroa twice now, while attending conferences, and I'll be there again this year. It's got everything I hope for when going to a conference - good communication while setting up my stay, attentive folks at the counter, and comfortable rooms. The breakfasts are good and reasonably priced, and I like being able to open the windows at night for fresh air. The street noise is more apparent with open windows, but it's easy enough to close them and use the AC. I didn't find the AC to be distracting when I had it turned on. The bathroom was clean and well-lit, there was plenty of closet space, and the TV had enough channels for me. The room service staff was friendly and efficient when I met them in the halls, and did a good job keeping the room clean. One thing I noticed was that the wireless was pretty slow. However, there were about 5000 programmers in town, and people who stayed in other (much more expensive) hotels had the same comment. Not a complaint, just an observation. The location is great - it costs fifty cents each way to take a bus to the LA County Museum of History, the Science Center, and the Rose Garden. The Jewelry District is within easy walking distance, as is the LA County Library, the country's shortest railway, and the Public Market. There are lots of places to eat within a minute's walk, and lots of tourist activities. I like the atmosphere at the Fig, and look forward to staying there again this year.

Reviews.Title: “10 reasons why we prefer this hotel over The Standard downtown”
Reviews.Author: uglybettyfan
Reviews.Content: We prefer hotels with a unique point of view - versus generic hotels like the Marriott/Holiday Inn. and the Ritz Carletons of the world are out of our price range. So BOTH The Standard (which we stayed at for 5 days in Dec) and the Hotel Figueroa (which we stayed at for 4 days in April) are the kind of places we like. I found it VERY HELPFUL to read a lot the Trip Advisor reviews to manage my expectations of Hotel Figueroa because a "tourist hotel" is very different from a "boutique hotel"  So that is why I want to put in my two cents, to help the next guest determine if this is the hotel for them. For example, my very particular husband  DID NOT read the reviews and was initially put off when we arrived because: no valet parking, no bellhop (it was after 10pm onEaster Sunday though) and they have old fashioned room keys with a plastic tag with the room number, instead of the modern card keys we are used to. However by the time we left he fell in love with the place and is already talking about coming back.   To cut down on typing I will refer to Hotel Figueroa as HF and the Standard as TS 1 HF makes you feel like you are on a Hollywood set of a Moroccan movie. (Shakira shot a music video here awhile ago and while we were there a commercial was being filmed).  TS makes you feel like a mid-level executive in the entertainment/fashion industry. Both hotels have a touch of fantasy, just different type of fantasy. 2  HF is literally across the street from LA Live and with all the restaurants, grammy musuem and entertainment venues located there, it means you don't have to be a slave to your car which is often the case in Los Angeles. TS is only about 5 blocks away from LA live, but I wouldn't recommend walking there at night. Besides the LA main library, not much else is near TS except other hotels and office buildings so there is not much to do outside of the hotel.  3 HF front desk staff is from Central America/Mexico and they rarely cracked a smile or provided anything more than average customer service. I think if you speak Spanish they are a little friendlier based on what I observed. TS staff are young, outgoing and friendly and understand what is means to be in the hospitality industry. But considering the difference in the price of the rooms of the two hotels, it isn't fair to expect outstanding customer service too. 4 The bulk of HF guests during our visit were European tourists, young and old. At TS it was a lot of NY'ers on business, everyone on their mobile device. And on the weekend it was a young party crowd playing loud music and the hallway reeked of marijuana.  5 HF has charming and romantic pool/bar area with incredible foliage and cacti. Feels like an oasis in the midst of the glitzy LA. Very relaxed vibe. TS has a rooftop pool/bar area  with killer view and it is definetly a party/pick up scene with everyone looking tan and fit. 6 Our only meal at HF was one breakfast and it was reasonably priced but nothing special. Fortunately they are between The Pantry and Magnolia on one side and all the restaurants at LA live on the other. (Maybe we would have had dinner here if they had bellydancers to complement the Morrocan theme.) TS Standard is a tad pricey for the portion size but has delicious food - especially the chicken and waffles. There are some other restaurants nearby, but not as many as HF. 7 HF parking is $12 which is a big savings for this neighborhood where $30 and up is going rate. You have to self park, the occasional attendant there is just to monitor that you have a parking permit on the dashboard and there is 24 hour video survelliance. This is a good thing because you have to drive down an alley (well lit, but alley nevertheless) behind the hotel to get to the parking lot. This felt a little scary when we first arrived. Parking at TS is $30 and they have parking attendants to bring your car. Tipping these guys every time you need your car starts to add up if you are going in and out for several days. And if there is a function going on at the hotel, the wait to get your car can be long. 8 HF has refrigerator in the room so can bring your own snacks/ treats (no microwave or coffee pot though) TS has a fully stocked minibar so only things can have in frig is what they sell you 9  Although HF rooms have an unconventional design in terms of decor - the room configuration is conventional. Meaning they have an armoire with drawers, big closet, multiple mirrors, nightstands. None of this was at TS. If you are staying more than a weekend, this matters. I also didn't like the bathtub/shower in the middle of the room at TS nor the beds on the floor. 10 We did NOT experience any of the complaints that a few reviewers mentioned - dirty room, homeless people nearby or a noisy room. Our room was on the 9th floor overlooking the pool. When our window was open we could here faint sounds of the music from the bar, but because we liked the musical selections, it wasn't a problem. We do wish they had free Wifi- like The Standard, to keep us from going next door to Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Figueroa Hotel, the best place to stay in Downtown LA!”
Reviews.Author: Amy L
Reviews.Content: Great vibe, great atmosphere, the most uniquely decorated hotel, fun to stay in. I love the Figueroa Hotel! It’s so accommodating in so many ways, comfortable, very clean, good food, great prices. To me, it is the best hotel in Downtown LA, at the very least. I wasn’t expecting this Moroccan hotel to be so home-y, but I would definitely choose to stay here when I need to be in Downtown. The rooms are like going on a little adventure. The staff is wonderful, warm, and very welcoming. I would also go there to eat, too, great food, and very reasonable, not to forget a fabulous atmosphere in the lobby. In so many ways, I was treated very nicely here. Stay here when you are going to an event, too. I think this hotel is a treat to the senses. Thank you Figueroa, for you being you! Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character and great location but could do with refinement”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyHedgehog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights in March whilst attending a conference. The Figueroa is ideally situated for downtown/LA Live and is better value than some of the newer, plusher hotels. However, the shabby chic des sometimes leave a little to be desired such as singe pane windows that don't eliminate traffic noise or draughts and a heater/air conditioning unit that sounds like a small jet aircraft. My room was a good size with a huge bed, just wish it had been more recently refurbished to add a bit more comfort. Having said that, I'd probably stay here again if visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: nyan777
Reviews.Content: Just got back after staying 2 days in this hotel with my daughter. I have to admit that I was a bit hesitant to go in the hotel seeing that it looked a bit shady from the outside but we didn't have much choice since it was a busy week with 2 conventions going on and most of the surrounding hotels were completely booked. I appreciated that they did give us a room even though they said they were sold out. We stayed on the 6th floor in a room that was facing Figueroa street. First night, one can hear people yelling, cars, sirens, street bumps from the street outside. It didn't quiet down until about 12:30 am. There was a huge billboard with extremely bright lights pointing up from the Luxe Hotel across the street so alot of the light was going in our room. Needless to say, I could not get any sleep! To top that off one can hear doors slamming and people walking/talking around in the hallway. I was also a bit concerned about security since anyone can go in/out of the hotel and up the elevators although there was a chain at the door and the lock on the door knob but that was it. I called front desk and asked if they can provide ear plugs or eye mask, but this isn't a 3 or 4 start hotel. They tried to be accomodating and said that they can move me to another room on the 2nd or 4th floor but they were both facing Figueroa St so it may be worse. They sent a maintenance guy to come see what he can do and I asked for a blanket to be rolled and placed on top of the curtain to prevent the lights from coming in. He was nice enough to do that. Next morning, I asked to be placed in another room which helped a bit. I asked if the blanket can be placed on top of the curtains but the front desk stated that it was not something they can do even though I told them that it was already done the day before. This new room still faced Figuroa but a part of the building blocked the room from the lights and also the street noise and there was blinds although some lights still went through at the top. I finally got some sleep on the second night. The television was small perhaps 15in wide and the remote sometimes did not turn on the TV, i.e. you have to turn it on manually, then the rest of the remote worked. There was a small refrigerator but I don't think it was cold enough. For some reason, it was hot in the rooms. Both the fan and heater were both off as I didn't want to blow dust around as the curtains were a bit dusty at the top. The bed is reasonably comfortable and the bathroom seemed clean but old. It did feel like we were staying in a developing country. Parking was in the back of the hotel and very cramped. I rented a brand new car and didn't get the insurance which covers for scratches so I was always concerned that it might get scratched, but thank God it didn't. The guys at the parking lot were helpful and accomodating. Yes, we were staying at the heart of downtown so I can't really complain much about all the noise and staff did try to accomodate and helped with the room change which is why I rated this hotel an average instead of poor.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem; a visual and sensory delight; an oasis in the heart of the urban center.”
Reviews.Author: annebubkgs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Great value. Less expensive is the OK but forgettable conference hotel I had originally planned to stay at. A wonderful experience and 1 of my best "finds" ever. Perfect for art, architecture, or history lovers. So many guests were walking around taking pictures with their cell phones of this beautiful place. Myself included.

Reviews.Title: “Charming atmosphere, good downtown location, and affordable in comparison...”
Reviews.Author: Sone-a-rone
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here to participate in a conference. It not only had a really fun, unique Bohemian feel, but it was only two blocks away from the convention center, and was one of the most affordable options in the area. It was clean, comfortable and close to some nice restaurants. A few things to know: 1. It feels like you are staying in a small, older, European room out of a movie 2. They do NOT have irons and ironing boards in the room (only important if you are trying to look really nice for a conference or meeting) 3. The pool they describe is small and does not have any chaise lounges (that I saw), so be prepared to lay out and get some sun on your towel. 4. The breakfast downstairs is not included, and is also not that great (basic, cafeteria-style), I would recommend the nearby The Farm... great brioche french toast!

Reviews.Title: “Great oasis in the city!”
Reviews.Author: annaha
Reviews.Content: A few years ago, when in Los Angeles, I walked by the Hotel Figueroa, stopped, and decided if ever back in LA that's where I'd stay. And it's even better than I imagined. The lobby's exotic décor and warm ambiance are at once welcoming; the pool and bar are lovely. And my room - a large room to share - was fantastic! I felt as if I were in a movie set. Breakfast with good coffee offers limited selections but is quick and very reasonably priced. One evening a friend and I ate a hamburger in the cafe with really good fries and nice $6 glasses of wine. I love the wild paintings on the 13 story towers that can be seen when walking back from the Convention Center and apparently change at times. These now are of Sasha Baron Cohen as Barack in 3 different and amusing guises. It was fun watching painters on rather skimpy scaffolding hand painting at times and other times using spray paint. Talented commercial artists. Music plays - often in the background - but one morning at breakfast a glorious aria swelled into the large space. Awesome! The hotel is clean - cleaning staff are friendly and helpful. The owner/manager is most generous with a sense of humor. There's no concierge or bell-person - it's not that kind of place. Wi-Fi is really reasonable.. $5 for 24 hours! Parking is $12 a day.. This hotel isn't for everyone. If you need slick, high-tech surroundings, this is not for you. But it's lovely for the others of us - who long for a little bit of Marrakesh or even Latin America (at times I thought Middle East or North Africa - other times, very Latino). It's great!

Reviews.Title: “A nice change”
Reviews.Author: WSG34
Reviews.Content: I travel almost weekly and stay at the typical business hotels and this was such a nice change. The hotel has lots of character. The sleeping room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It's an older property so don't expect anything modern and fancy. I love the Moroccan theme throughout the hotel. Check out the pool area in the back, very quaint and nicely done. I had breakfast downstairs and it's a buffet where you pay for each item but it is VERY inexpensive! (2 pancakes and eggs cost me $3.37). The hotel staff was also very friendly and accommodating. The parking lot for the hotel is a bit hard to find. It's behind the hotel thru an alley and it's $12 a day to park which is reasonable considering some of the other downtown hotels that are $45 a day to park. Walking distance to LA Live, Staples Center and the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to try something different – so glad we did!”
Reviews.Author: hppytrvler
Reviews.Content: I was tired of the same large hotel chains and decided to take my money elsewhere. I saw the Hotel Figueroa across from the Staples Center and LA Live and decide to give it a try. You walk in and go back in time into what seems to be an old Moroccan movie set. The 13 story building was built in 1926 but the novelty and experience was still very new and exciting. We were welcomed by the hotel’s very charming and helpful proprietor. He gave us a few recommendations for dinner and sites to view around town. What I noticed were the other hotel guests were also enthralled with unique décor and artwork and tapestries around the hotel and expressed their liking of the hotel. The staff was conscientious and we were never lost in a crowd. The rooms are decorated with the same theme and made it very fun. The hotel is surrounded by giant modern hotel chains and food establishments so the only problem is making decisions as to what you want to eat. One recommendation made by the hotel manager was to go across the street to the neighboring hotel’s 26th floor and enjoy the views. The views were breathtaking! The Figueroa’s pool is heated and the bar is a very nice place to hang out. It comes alive in the evening as many come to enjoy the unique vibe of this very different place. Our experience was positive and memorable. We will be back to this small oasis in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “The Fig is still the best”
Reviews.Author: BlankaML23
Reviews.Content: I used to come to the Figueroa Hotel as a professional tour guide with groups for many years. After I moved back to Europe, I did not have the opportunity to visit until recently. Wow, the place has gotten only better. If you are looking for a tourist class hotel with all the amenities yet centrally located, this is your place. The price is right, the comfort is certainly all there, the location is incredible being right next to the Staple Center and the new L.A Live complex in downtown LA. The "A1" goes to the service, as always. The staff is not only friendly and accommodating, it feels like they really care about you - rare in this world. The Moroccan theme, mixed with early California genuine artifacts from that era, enhance the appeal. Blanka M. Lukes from Prague

Reviews.Title: “great, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stan C
Reviews.Content: this was a great change from the cookie cutter hotels. I go on vacation every year to new cities and watch hockey games. Hotel Fig was originally picked for being close to the venue, but it turns out it was a nice relaxing place to stay. Check in went smoothly and having an Old School key was kind of cool. The lobby is so cool, some nice decorations and a piano too. Of course, you need to know how to play or Uno will get "mad". PS. I can't play that well. We got to our room (#930) and it was just as the picture looked. Very roomy and nicely decorated. The beds were super soft (I think they are new) the room had 2 closets (we missed the 2nd one for a couple hours) and a little fridge too. Again the room was way bigger than the normal hotels. The room had a non-working old piano and that is where the TV was located. I think they should get some new TV's. it's a good distance away from the beds, so a new one would help (even though we were not in room alot). The windows even opened, so it was nice to have fresh air, well LA air. The bathroom, as others have mentioned, was not super big, but it worked out perfect for us. The shower head needs to be a little higher as quick fix. Maid service was done and on one sleep in day they even called to ask if we wanted maid service. We had plans for most of our stay, but we did stop at the hotel bar and it was nice, not many bottled beers. Having onsite parking was nice, it was $12 a day, so not bad for the area. Overall, we had a blast and Hotel Fig will be used in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: anne b
Reviews.Content: Others words that come to mind are romantic, intimate and fun. The place is eye candy for people tired of sterile, cookie cutter hotels. It's an exotic paradise without ever leaving the Continental US . The owner was hands on and available for a private tour. When next I visit LA, I know where I will be staying…

Reviews.Title: “pool and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Roberto J S
Reviews.Content: i used this a a safe place to relax and recover from disney and other studios good relax and made friends

Reviews.Title: “Great choice Downtown”
Reviews.Author: spunge411
Reviews.Content: The location is superber. Across the street from Staples Center and LA live. 5 min cab ride to Spring street with even more bars and cafes. The rooms are nicely decorated with a moroccan flair. even the small rooms are large enough for 2 people. Small rooms have Queen size beds. If your heading to Downtown LA...Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “'Like Water for Chocolate' The owner's love elevates this place”
Reviews.Author: doglaw
Reviews.Content: Just today as the snow fell in Vancouver, I found myself reminiscing fondly about this amazing place and my return trip to it over Thanksgiving. This hotel has captured my imagination, and even in recollection, it takes my breath away. With so much attention to detail, the owners have missed nothing in building a magical setting, rife with warmth and splendour. The lobby, pool and bar are magnificent. Poolside is spacious, yet cosy and comfortable. The landscaping with the plants and fountain transported us elsewhere and made us forget we were in downtown LA, a mere half minute from the bustle and big box of LA Live. At night especially, the ambient lighting out here was lush and colorful, the perfect accent to a beautiful November night. We hadn’t considered spending an evening at the poolside bar, but it turned out to be one of our best decisions. The lobby is high-ceilinged and dim which created a very warm twilight affect, accompanied by gigantic trees in massive vases with sprawling chandeliers and lamps overhead, all of which contributing to the bazaar (and enchantingly bizarre) qualities. No better room could welcome you to this hotel, and there is no better place (other than poolside) to start the day. The straight-forward and very fairly priced breakfast is served here in an environment conducive to strategizing the day ahead. The owners’ love of their hotel manifests itself everywhere. I stayed in a different room than my last visit and pleasantly surprised how the rooms were unique and so different from each other in their layouts, colors, and furnishing. It was so refreshing being somewhere that wasn’t cookie cutter. Something as small and seemingly insignificant as a hotel room door has been afforded painstaking detail here where many doors are profoundly different and home to its individual and intricate one of a kind design. Similarly, some of the hallway lamps are housed in hanging lead fixtures which flicker hospitably, yet give a medieval and timeless aura. And the silver house phones in the lobby complement the space, despite being weirdly modern. I regret not snapping photos of all these elements, but can take solace in the fact I know we will come back here at some point. It’s become a destination in itself for us. It would be unfair to close without complimenting the staff on their professionalism and attentiveness. The stunning architecture and interiors would be devoid of vitality if the staff wasn’t as friendly and helpful as they were. They seem to share the owners’ love and respect of this property and were quick to ensure we had the best stay possible.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonable if going to LA LIve area”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is not a five star hotel and when you pull up in front you will think "oh boy what did I do (no street appeal). This is an old hotel that goes way back and does have some history to it and charm. It is old, so it does have that old building feel and smell to it. We were joking as it looks like hallways that you may see in a horror movie (dark and erie) But, If you are going to Staples, LA live, NOkia etc. then for the money it is worth it. You can always go up the street and pay 3 times as much at new Ritz. Luxe, or Marriot. The rooms are not fancy and the bathrooms are like a high school gym, but it does have an interesting appeal. The blinds in room will not let you sleep in , as they let in a lot of light. We did hear a lot of street noise all night long and the beds were rock hard. The TV is old school and there is a small frig in room. There is a nice patio bar next to pool that we found nice. You can order food from the lobby bar area and they will bring it to you. All in All I would stay there again if going to concert or event as everyhting is right there to walk. BTW, parking is only $12/night compared to $30+ at other hotels. If you need plush or fancy, then dont go here, but if you want a reliable convenient and reasonable place for a night, and interesting then it works.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hotel in the country..... bar none!”
Reviews.Author: BoatmanPVD
Reviews.Content: If you want your feet kissed. If you want your every need tended to. If you want wall to wall carpeting. If you want all the amenities that modern American hotels have to offer.... I suggest you look elsewhere. If what you want is a fun, comfortable, funky, down to Earth, comfortable place to land in Downtown L.A., "The Fig" is it! I have spent at least 200 nights here and saw this site when I was looking for their phone number to make my reservation for New Year's Eve. I am taking my new girlfriend "home" to The Fig. She has never been and we are traveling across the country (from Cape Cod) to celebrate in L.A. Every time I walk through the doors, I am joyous. It is hard to explain the allure of The Fig. Here, I have forged lifelong friendships, conducted important business, and met many people who have been and continue to be important parts of my life. The Fig is a melting pot. Embracing it is so much easier than critcizing it. Sometimes I get a room on a lower floor so that I can walk up and down in the morning rather than wait for the elevator. Sometimes I don't. The bottom line, here, is that The Fig is not for everyone. If you aren't willing to let your hair down a little, if you must have room service at midnight and 75 channels on the TV and if you idolized Thurston Howell III, it probably isn't for you. If, however, you would like enjoy some time with fans of Gilligan and Maryanne and the rest of the fun folks, join us by the pool, at the bar or in the lobby. I can't wait to get home to The Fig.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: TanyaN3
Reviews.Content: I was going to this hotel for a convention and it is close to the convention center. Upon Check in they gave me a room that was terrably tiny. I decided I'd see what other rooms they have the next room they gave me was better...but it had two twin beds...and it was just crappy overall quality. I heard their suites are very nice but the pictures on the homage are just so decieving. I thought I was going to a great modern hotel but instead I felt like I was at a motel and for the 600 I paid for 3 nights it was so not worth it. If I find out any of my friends booked it for con. I always tell them their better off elsewhere. The Pro's are that it is walking distance to the L.A. Convention Center, breakfast is good and cheap, and they have a nice pool, not that I ever had time to use it...

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind, neo Moorish decor close to Conv. & Staples Cntr.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1155
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times and really enjoy the place. But it is definitely not for everyone. If you like all the amenities, contemporary fixtures , lighting window treatments and audio video , look elsewhere. This place is for romantics who love experiencing uncommon atmosphere. I was there with a 20 something client for a big trade show, and she was not at all comfortable. She said it felt like she was staying in someone else's room. The lobby is lovely if a bit dark and mysterious. The pool , with all the great plants an artwork strewn about, and adjoining bar is a perfect place to hang in late afternoon. The rooms are of the period , mostly original I assume, adequate and very clean but outfitted rather randomly and unique not as much for comfort but for atmosphere. It feels like an L.A. adventure walking thru the building. I think this would appeal greatly to European visitors, especially French, who love things with character . The proximity to so many day and night time attractions , Convention Center , Staples Center, LA Live , Club Nokia is a real plus, except maybe the noise at night. Yes the windows are old and not well insulated for sound. Forget the restaurant downstairs for breakfast you HAVE to go the the Pantry just down the street at 877 South Figueroa. Another LA classic. This area and the Fig is a good home base for a day or two. If nothing else , stop by for a drink and just check out the architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel in the universe”
Reviews.Author: MiaVonHenderbush
Reviews.Content: WARNING: This review is not only long overdue, it's also going to be long, period. And possibly florid. Get some coffee and settle in. The Figueroa Hotel has been an incredibly important fixture in my life for many years. An oasis in the middle of downtown Los Angeles, the Fig is the most beautiful and magical hotel I have ever visited, and this includes stays at the Ritz in Paris and various overpriced monstrosities in London and on the coast of Monaco. I had my wedding reception at the Fig, I celebrated two anniversaries there, and I've spent far too many hours hanging out and drinking with buddies at Rick's Place, the covered bar outside by the pools and walled cactus garden. If I had my way, I'd live there. Good to know up-front: If you resonated with the traveling style of George Clooney's character in "Up In The Air," and are a fan of those Best Western ExecuSuite type accoutrements -- TV-Bigger-Than-Bed, cookie-cutter execudesk and "confab area"; poly-fiber bedspread that picks up inoffensive pale peach color scheme of room; hairdryer, mini coffeemaker and high-speed WiFi in the molded plastic bathroom; Nutty SnakMix in the minibar; continental breakfast of stale muffins and canned orange juice; free shuttle to the local Aqua Park; Absolutely No Surprises -- you're going to hate this place. Try the Ramada or whatever it's called across the street. But if you're interested in combining form with function -- uncommon loveliness and a sense of the exotic with comfort and affordability -- then you need to check out the Fig. That sounds strange, no? Would never put those two scenarios together, right? That's a big part of what makes the Fig so unusual. It's difficult to list the things I love about the Fig in any kind of order because my experience of it has always been more about the whole vs the sum of its parts, sort of thing. If I close my eyes and think back, multiple images flash by: - the flickering light from the tin and colored glass Moroccan lamps; - the deep blues, burnt oranges and rich reds of the unique and intimate guest rooms decorated with antique furniture, original artworks and tapestries; - evenings spent lounging with friends and a bottle of bubbly by a fountain in the walled cactus garden, bathed in reflections of light rippling up from the tiled mosaic floor of the heated wading pool; - mornings in the same garden, this time breakfasting al fresco by the tiled swimming pool, aware of the omnipresent L.A. helicopters, but still feeling like I'm in the desert somewhere, maybe on my way to a secret rendezvous, oversized sunglasses and floppy hat de rigeur. - the magnificent lobby, a fabulous melange of various influences. Is it Moroccan? Is it Spanish Colonial? Do I care? - Oh! The entrance from the back alley, this long passageway of wrought iron and flowering hibiscus vines into the walled garden, past the pool and bar and into the main lobby. It's like following a path into some magical world. Well, it's not "like" that; it actually is. One last thing: Since a place is only ever as good as its people, a word needs to be said about the management, i.e. Uno Thimansson, the owner, the operator, the manager -- it's hard to know his title is because he's a cagey fellow and rarely admits to anything. I've never experienced such warm and magnanimous treatment from anyone in the so-called hospitality industry -- he's nicer than my parents, actually. When I called at the last minute to find out about having our reception at the Fig -- um, because we actually eloped, like with a week's notice -- Uno helped me figure out how to do it on the cheap (without making me feel like a loser) and found us a room, even though they were already sold out. During the whole process, I kept saying, "It's fine, I'll find another place," but he'd say, "No, hold on. I think I can figure something out. Let me call you back." It's been like that every time I've been back, whether to beg for a room at (always always always) the last minute because I just came into some unexpected cash or to prevail on them to keep the bar open for One Last Drink. And it's not like the hotel makes much money of me or any of my broke (yet charming!) bohemian arteeste buddies. Still, Uno and his staff are unfailingly gracious, treating me and my raggedy gang like royalty. Hell, I'm only writing this review now, and it's been six years already, so that can't explain the continued kindness and generosity over the years. Like I said, this place is magical.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bickerays
Reviews.Content: The pics online made it look cool and intriguing. It was anything but that. It was old, dark, and had a vibe of being in a 3rd world country. Nothing was included- no coffee pot, no ironing board, no lampshade. You had to buy a cup of coffee from the restaurant. The pool, jacuzzi, and bar were always closed for "private events" in the evenings, so you couldn't enjoy any of those things. It had a window unit for a/c with a radiator for heat???? We didn't even have a dresser in our room or anywhere to put our clothes. There was an old piano (without keys) that served as the TV stand. The blankets on the bed were more like sack cloths and actually rubbed the skin off the back of my legs...like rug burn. It was a horrible experience and I think homeless shelters are probably better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Shakira I'm Waiting”
Reviews.Author: Tom P
Reviews.Content: Great vibe here. Stopped in twice after work and met some decent folk each time. The night lighting and amazing cactus garden backed up the Arabian Nights theme.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect oasis in the middle of the city.”
Reviews.Author: lila74_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a weekend exploring downtown LA and decided to make this hotel our home base. We couldn't have been happier. The hotel is so unique, you feel that you are staying in some old colonial hotel in North Africa until you look up and see that you are in fact in downtown LA. My only advice is to keep in mind that it is an old building in a busy part of town and light sleepers might want to bring some earplugs. We will definitely be back and next time we will upgrade to a Moroccan Suite although the normal room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: audiojay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place many years ago and decided to revisit it for a recent trip to Los Angeles. The best way I can describe this hotel is that is an oasis in downtown LA. You walk in and you're transported to a different world. The architecture is kind of latin, kind of Moroccan. Lots of arches, lots of colors. Great, friendly staff. Our room was a regular room with a king bed (I believe). It was a bit oddly laid out, but comfortable and quiet, other than noise from the street (which can be substantial if there is a lot going on at the neighboring arenas). The window air conditioner helped mask some of the street noise, but sirens cut right through it. There was a ceiling fan above the bed which is probably all you really need on everything but really hot days. The bed was comfortable but nothing to write home about. The room had a desk, a couple of comfortable (not cushy) chairs, an ottoman, a dresser, a table. Colors tended toward rich red tones. Two closets, one didn't seem to be used often and had a musty smell, but the other was just fine. Things that seemed to be missing were an ice bucket, lots of blurbs about the hotel itself, and a mini-bar stocked with too-expensive treats. The hotel has a parking lot our back which seems really small for a hotel this size (12 stories) but we always had a space. One note about the lot is that you must turn into it off of Olympic and cannot get to it from Figueroa. You'll need to wave off all of the parking attendants if there is an event going on and tell them you're staying at the hotel. If you need web access or want to print your boarding pass, you can use a small netbook at the reception desk. The first five or so printed pages are free. The lobby and kitchen area are very comfortable and there were always people in them, unlike some hotels that feel too cold for humans to feel at home in. The two days we were there, the kitchen had a buffet breakfast that was good and inexpensive (priced by the item so you could choose what your meal cost, not just what you wanted). They'll even make you a latte or espresso if you prefer. Wander out back and you discover the bar/pool area, which looks and feels a lot like you're in a tropical paradise and not in downtown LA. Stay here for the vibe, the atmosphere, and the location. Don't stay here if you're expecting the Four Seasons treatment. If I need to visit downtown LA again, the Figueroa will be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool area”
Reviews.Author: KaplanvsKaplan
Reviews.Content: This property is right across the street from "LA Live", which is a great location. It boasts a lovely pool/bar area, which is truly beautiful and romantic. The rooms are very tired, but still charmimg. The bathrooms could use some updating, especially the towels! They are worn and extremely thin, so it was like drying yourself off with sandpaper. Seriously, this is our biggest complaint, but it can be a deal-breaker. Other than that, the bed was very comfortable, and the staff was more than accommodating. However, the bar could use a few more wine choices other than just red and white.

Reviews.Title: “Service was poor...food was worse.”
Reviews.Author: agentscooper
Reviews.Content: Front desk was poor, food was bad, hotel not clean enough. Good was they have a parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: MickMalizia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Moroccan theme. Hotel is very old but kept up very well. Beds are comfortable and hotel is clean. Nice pool and bar area. Staff was great. Ale' carte breakfast very reasonable. definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Vibe”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadKim
Reviews.Content: Because of my husband's job, 99% of the time we end up staying in Marriott properties when we travel. While I'm not complaining, I love to find gems like this. We were at this hotel in July because some dear friends of ours from Michigan had some business in LA and we joined them at the Figueroa for one night. Our loss. Wish it had been longer. I just loved everything about this place. I loved taking the stairs and finding several different ways to to our room. I loved the service, the lobby, the pool area with all its amazing statues and metal and glass artwork, the bar, the cafeteria-style restaurant. Our room and our friends' room were so different and unique in how they were decorated. I had a bottle of wine waiting for our friends when they arrived and imagine my surprise that they didn't gouge me on the price. Totally reasonable and the woman who made it happen couldn't have been nicer. She even arranged for the girls to get ice cream downstairs when they arrived. Oh, almost forgot, for the reviewer who compared this place to a homeless shelter? We went out shopping in the nearby Fashion District and my husband fell asleep on one of the quite comfortable couches downstairs and one of the hotel employees nudged him and told him he couldn't sleep there. So the hotel is on the lookout for the homeless!!!

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was at a homeless shelter”
Reviews.Author: teejay1111
Reviews.Content: The issues with this hotel start at the front door, and ended when I checked out. It was clean, but the decor is very dark, and very outdated. The artwork on the wall of my room was not in good taste at all. The noise from the air conditioning unit made a peaceful rest impossible. I was also not happy about the lack of ice makers on any floor. I had to go to the front desk for ice. The air in the hallways was not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A unique and delightful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dara N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our anniversary at the Figueroa Hotel and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The lobby was gorgeously appointed with unique and ornate details bringing to mind a Spanish-Moroccan fantasy world. The pool was a lush fountain filled paradise amazingly set amid the towers of downtown Los Angeles. Our room was also decorated according to the overall theme of the hotel and was a nice size with a comfortable king bed. The manager jokingly mistook us for a young Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz and could not have been friendlier. My wife and I simply loved this place and are looking forward to going back to this unique and delightful gem very soon. We hope to get one of the great looking suites which unfortunately were not available during our stay. All I can say to finish this review is thank you for making our anniversary special and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “My Daughter's wedding, almost ruined !!!!”
Reviews.Author: keith p
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very old and nothing is updated, to include plumbing, electrical and overall construction. Your room is cooled by a portable window air conditioner. As the father of the bride, footing the bill, I requested a copy of the "signed contract" to verify charges. I never received one, because there wasn't one, Instead I was constantly told, by Mgmt "It's no problem, trust us" or "I'll get back to you by e-mail" which was always days later and several ph calls. As for parking I was quoted a parking fee for vendors at "$15 per vehicle". Upon arriving I found that overnight guest were only chg'ed $12. When I asked about this, the response was "our parking rates are cheaper than any other hotel in the area". But yet vendors are only there for the event and we were to pay 25% more for their 6 hour stay !!! ??? When I asked to speak with the Mgr in a private setting, I was told "we will do it at the counter". A heated exchg then took place with the Mgr calling me rude and disrespectful for questioning their service pratices and my pointing out that there was never a signed contract accepting the costs. Now (the day of the wedding) I'm being presented an invoice with fees I questioned. This after spending over $15,000.00 in rooms and services. At the event it self, we had a sit down dinner and the staff brought out the dinner plates and food to each table. This was accomplished with guest assistance, "please pass this down" as you were handed a dinner plate, as apparently the staff could not be bothered to place the dinnerware at each guest's location. If the server could not find a location to place a food platter, it was simply handed to a guest and the server walked off, leaving the guests at the table to figure it out for themselves. Lastly, because no beverage was offered at the meal, if you wanted a simple glass of water you had to get up yourself and walk to a near by public bar and request it yourself as this was not made available either. I will never spend another penny at this location. I recommend anyone who does book any event or stay at this hotel, get everything in writing and obtain signatures from both the hotel and yourself on the document. Don't fall for the "Oh, it's no problem, we will work it out" !!

Reviews.Title: “To Celebrate My Daughters Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Milka P
Reviews.Content: Just got back from celebrating my daughters’ birthday in LA at the Figueroa Hotel. We stayed for 6 days and it was all that I had imagined. The staff was extremely helpful, nice and accommodating. I've been to LA 5 times so far for work (unfortunately don’t stay at the Figueroa) but this was my first time having fun. I'm glad at stayed at the Figueroa. The Figueroa is across the street from LA Live, so talk about location, location, LOCATION a few blocks away from the fashion district (best shopping in the world). The staff at the bar and restaurant are the best in the business and the staff at the lobby are always ready to recommend better places and ways to get their than you had planed for. The rooms are decorated with a Moroccan theme that is unique and pleasant to the norm from your usual hotels. The pool is quaint and refreshing. I would definatley stay their again and recommend it to anyone. My only regret is that I didn’t get to meet the famous Mr. Uno. Lol, who I’ve read about in the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Moroccan honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cbroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married here. It was as if having a destination wedding with the convenience of getting married locally. Uno helped us plan every step...from decor, food, beverage, even invitation suggestions. Every detail came together to transport our guests to Casablanca. After the wedding we heard over and over how unique, magical and fun our wedding was. Now that we have moved out of LA, we come back and always stay at The Fig. We love how every room has been meticulously designed, we love having cocktails by the pool in the afternoon. We have such fond memories here and continue to make new ones. While there are a few things The Fig could change to make it more appealing to a hip crowd, it is refreshing that those things haven't happened. I wouldn't want to give up my secret oasis to the types of people that hang at the Chateau or The Standard.

Reviews.Title: “XXXcellent!”
Reviews.Author: Hards2000
Reviews.Content: Amazing Amazing Amazing Experience..... A very different concept....A blend of Moroccan and Indian style! Uno the manager is too supportive and also the full staff ! Very centric (location)and everything that is restaurent, bars, and once of the best place for hang outs! Will go again definitely! Cheers~

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel but the price was right and location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: DiverBob57
Reviews.Content: You will see the word Quirky used in several TA reviews about this hotel. I didn't really get the meaning until I stayed there. It is a very old building in downtown LA that has not been refurbished entirely, meaning the plumbing and lighting fixtures are very "dated". I was placed in a room for one... and I do mean one! They warned me it was a small room before I booked it. All I was looking for was a place to sleep and clean up at the end of a long business day. This hotel definitely met those requirements but not much more than that. Upside for this hotel - Interesting Lobby decorated in Morrocan theme -Friendly staff -Clean room -Comfortable bed -Great location one block for LA Convention Center and Staples Center -Small dorm room size refrigerator Downside on this hotel - No irons or ironing boards in room (we had to share one on our floor) - very small rooms without much storage space - No desk with outlets for laptop or cell phone charging - No gift shop or lobby store to buy drinks or snacks There is a market just around the corner were you can purchase snacks, soda and bottle water to place in refrigerator in room. It is ~$55 cab ride from LAX to this hotel. You can use Supershuttle if you wish to save a few bucks with extra stops.

Reviews.Title: “The Figueroa Hotel is to hotels what Martin Denny is to music.”
Reviews.Author: John_Holecek
Reviews.Content: The Figueroa Hotel is to hotels what Martin Denny is to music; each in its own way perfect but not necessarily to everyone's taste. The rigorous and highly sophisticated decorative scheme mixing Moroccan, Middle Eastern and Asian motifs is simply astonishing. I have never stayed in a hotel where so many of the patrons are taking pictures of the interior. I was fortunate enough to have been given a thorough tour by the manager. For those looking for an exceptional experience - honeymoon, love nest, getting away from it all, whatever - I recommend booking one of the suites. There are also any number of party and banquet spaces for rent whose ambiance is like nothing you've ever experienced. if you need all the frills of a thoroughly modern hotel, this is not the hotel for you. But if you want an experience - as well as comfort and friendly staff - I recommend the hotel without reservation. The lobby, because it also contains the open restaurant area, is a place of intense energy, full of life and action. Probably the final deal maker is that the rooms are typically $100 below the average in downtown L.A.

Reviews.Title: “The Love of the owner is everywhere, incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cosmic1942
Reviews.Content: I think this Hotel is a jewel in an oasis of boring hotels, and if you have taste for the best that the personal touch of an owner can give, then you have got to stay here. I have traveled all over and will recommend this hotel to everyone I know. Staff is gracious and professional and the location close to the best in LA , LA Live is right across the street. Great value and something to be experienced, with all the night life and fun events in and around the hotel. It has real Class, and not like any other hotel in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and lack of amenities”
Reviews.Author: ajfd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Figueroa hotel for business to attend the WPC Microsoft convention from July 7th through the 15th. I was excited to stay at the hotel because of their great webite and pictures. However once I arrived at the hotel I was very disappointed. The service desk had apparently not charged the credit card the was used to secure the rooms so I had to provide mine. The room I had was small and had a tiny bathroom. The hotel didn't provide an iron or ironing board in the rooms. You had to call down to the front desk to get one and you could only use it for an hour. Their idea of room service is going down to the cafe, ordering your food there and bring it back to your room. You could not charged anything to your room. You had to pay on the spot. Now I have to keep track of multiple receipts for my expense report. The website states it was remodeled but they did not replace the single paned windows with double or triple paned windows. So you can hear everything that is going on outside. Using a flashy website and a fish eye lense to make the hotel a destination is false advertisement.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Jacobite111
Reviews.Content: We arrived on June 30th for our 4 day vacation to Anime Expo. Everyone at the Fig, from our first contact with the woman at the Desk, to meeting the owner himself, were all friendly and accommodating, making our trip to Los Angeles, and our stay enjoyable and comfortable for both myself and my Granddaughter. It's location made walking to the Convention Center easy. We stayed in room 415 which has two single beds. The beds were very comfiortable. The room nicely painted and the bathroom seemed large enough to me. Yes the Fig is an old Building, but I found none of the problems and have none of the complaints some people have put up here. The Air-conditioner worked great and kept the room cold :) The room was spotlessly clean and the maids had the room cleaned and beds made every afternoon when we came back "home" from the convention center. Hot and Cold water worked fine and having a deep tub was also nice and gave the option for a bath or shower!! The Beds... These were singles and at first I was a little worried since I have a bad back and had just gone through back surgery earlier in the year, so I tend to toss and turn at times. The bed was so comfortable, I slept peacefully and no tossing at all!!! And while we had a view of the intersection, the room was quiet and noise from the street did not disturb us, Even my Granddaughter loved the decor and the pool area and we made use of the pool during our stay. Overall the Fig is a wonderful alternative to staying at the pricier "plastic" and Steel hotels. Their Buffet for Breakfast is great, and the price even lower then going to Denny's. A big thank you to Uno and all the staff at the Fig. We will be back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “T-H-E W-O-R-S-T”
Reviews.Author: 1rockclimber
Reviews.Content: T-H-E W-O-R-S-T experience I have ever had at a hotel. Actually T-H-E W-O-R-S-T customer service experience I have ever had as well. Simply horrible. The owner, who works in the hospitality industry, does not have the slightest inkling about hospitality. We had booked 2 suites for 2 nights - but we left after the first night. I am no prima donna - I have stayed in $1 dormitory rooms in India that were equivalent, so I'm not scared to get my feet dirty - BUT, I am NOT happy to spend $450 a night for 2 nasty rooms: this is a former skid row flop house with musty halls that reek of urine, torn carpets, chicken wire windows, window AC unit, steam heat. And then to have the owner treat me like he's doing me a favor, is beyond the pale. I wont bore you with the bloody details - the things you would find to hate would be different than mine, but oh, you WOULD find things to hate. Instead, I am posting photos - please, please, please look at them carefully - they arent as pretty as the ones they post on their site. By the way, they'll have you pay $225 for a suite with an additional $12 to park and $5 if you want internet. We moved to The Los Angelino (a joie de vivre hotel), a beautiful modern hotel with great staff ($185 a night, FREE internet and FREE valet parking). Pay special mind to the aggressive and hostile way the owner responds to people who give his hotel poor reviews right here on Trip Advisor. Read between the lines people! Also note that there are 49 terrible reviews to 34 excellent - you can figure it out for yourself. At least you cant say you weren't warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Taco84098
Reviews.Content: This was written after our second stay here. This hotel is a delightful change from the "cookie cutter" solution so many hotels seem to try for. The building is an old YWCA that has been transformed into a unique Moroccan motif tourist hotel. The lobby and comfortable rooms are full of antique looking lamps and accessories like persian style carpets that lend the whole place a very antique arabesque look and feel. Not at all like the run of the mill box rooms you find at chain hotels downtown. Comfortable beds. The hotel is often booked with overseas tour groups which accentuates the foreign feel of the hotel. The pool bar is truly a Casablanca style oasis in the middle of downtown. The walled gardens surrounding the pool, lushly landscaped and the soothing chillout music will have you forgetting that you are on the edge of the center of downtown. Breakfast is similar to the standard buffet table items you find at the bigger chain hotels except that all items are à la carte, so you only pay for what you want. A big plate of scrambled eggs, sausage, hash browns (with Cholula hot sauce, yum!) and coffee was only $6.00, a welcome relief from the only slightly better buffet at the Hilton up the street for $24. Parking was right next door and only $10 or $12(? I think) All of the staff are extremely welcoming and helpful. Uno, the manager, takes a very personal interest in making your stay a pleasant one and will likely be the one taking your phone resevation. If you are looking for a sterile, standard luxury downtown hotel, move on. If you are looking for an unusual, quirky decor, tourist hotel, with a great location next to LA Live and an attentive staff and one of the best values in the downtown areas, look no farther. For an even better treat, splurge and book one of the lavishly decorated suites. They are only a little bit more and the attention to detail antique lamps captivated us. We will definitely come back a third time!

Reviews.Title: “A Great alternative to boring, cookie cutter hotels.”
Reviews.Author: deetman
Reviews.Content: It used to be that traveling meant experiencing something new--unique stays, foods, shopping. As our culture has become more and more homogenized, that seems to be less and less the case. The Hotel Fig is a great, notable exception. We stayed for two nights, and LOVED the quirkiness, one of a kind furnishings, fun/funky vibe, beautiful pool/bar area, and easy access to LA and Hollywood. If you prefer mid range chain hotels, this might not appeal to you. If, however, you are looking for a cool, unusual Oasis in or near downtown LA, don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning lobby, good value.”
Reviews.Author: bythemoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the edge of downtown, so it isn't quite as convenient to most downtown sights as some of the other hotels, unless you're interested in L.A. Live and the Convention Center, which are close by. It's hard to describe the beautiful and atmospheric lobby -- are you in Marrakesh? Moorish Spain? Casablanca? Down a tiled corridor, and you're in the bar and pool area, but you could be in some exotic corner on the other side of the world; the pool is especially beautiful at night. I had one of the smaller rooms, and it was a bit tight, but the furnishings and colors were lovely and the bathroom was fine. This room did have a small "pantry" with a shelf and a small fridge, which came in very handy. One trip to the Ralph's nearby, and I had it well-stocked for quick meals in my room. One thing that was bothersome is that there is no free WiFi in the rooms; you have to use the computer on the front desk counter in the lobby, which is OK for quick sessions but not if you plan to be online for a while. Otherwise, this hotel is a bargain and has to be seen to be believed. Stops on L.A.'s metro system are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: fantasia035
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, if small hotel. Unless I looked up at the skyscrapers, I would have thought I was in Spain, not the middle of LA.

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden gem in the middle of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight
Reviews.Content: Attended a friend's Bday party in Hotel Fig's outdoor Morrocan style pool bar for the first time. Very impressive with location and the view of the surrounding L.A. skyline. The mojitos were very good and strong, but heard the wine by the glass wasn't too good. The sampler Mexican appetizer platter was expensive (about $50.00) and one of the worst tasting Mexican food I've had in a while. Order a plate of french fries at the lobby lounge, and they'll bring it to you by the pool bar, for only $2.10 instead. The view and the location is worth the visit. Great place to for Bday party.

Reviews.Title: “Oh. Dear. (Not in a good way.)”
Reviews.Author: weekenderPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: I've traveled in developing countries. I'm down with staying in not-top-notch places; I'm still under 30. It's cool; sometimes that's what available, sometimes that's what the budget is. But this. Dear me. Some things are unacceptable as matters of health, safety, and security. In that category: 1) No deadbolt on our door. None. Not ok. And keys only... easy to copy keys. Not safe. 2) No safe in our room. 3) Electrical outlets jerry-rigged and looking extremely unsafe - two prong only! The one behind the bed was impossible to reach, but that was probably good, because it might have set me on fire. 4) Air conditioner, which needed some firm whacks to get it going and seemed circa 1984, had enough dust accumulated in it that we seriously debated turning it on. That kind of stuff is gross. And easy to keep clean; no excuse. 5) Security of your personal information: this place is run on a typewriter-and-carbon-paper system. At the front desk, not only can they not do anything quickly, they also risk the security of guest (and credit card!) information. Upgrade this stuff; no excuse. In the not-security/health risk but still bad: 1) The towels. C'mon. As small as could be, awkward if you're sharing a room with a colleague, but also thin and worn. 2) Toiletry amenities were kind of vintage-y cute, but insufficient. Thus, not ironically cute. More like you were still in the early 1980s and sort of regretting it. 3) "Breakfast." It belongs in quotation marks, trust me. On the plus-ish sides: 1) It was clean enough. The beds were old and dorm-like, mattresses bad, and sheets were not nice, but it seemed clean. 2) Someone has clearly tried hard to decorate with care. It is sort of endearing, because they obviously tried, but you can't make an old YMCA into a Moroccan boutique hotel. It still smells like my college dorm - maybe the grout from the tiles or something? Industrial cleaners? It makes me think "no way will I ever go for 'Moroccan,' because it means 'this stuff is old so we'll make it dark and maybe no one will notice.'" 3) The pool area is nice for a drink - the kitsch works there. The building is old - own it. Don't try to make it into some weird Moroccan theme. Go with the vintage-YMCA/college dorm feeling. That could bring up a lot of interesting memories for people. But to go Moroccan-esque, it only enhances the impression that one is traveling in a developing country. Upgrade the electrical outlets, door locks, and your reservation/payment system, at a bare minimum. Please.

Reviews.Title: “The Figureroa is more of a european style Tourist Class hotel/hostel -”
Reviews.Author: jperez11
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at this hotel, which was chosen for me by a convention booking agency. I read the mxed reviews on this site with concern while still trying to keep an open mind. Honestly, I've stayed in far worse hotels and if I'd been in Ecuador or Tunisia, I would have thought it was adequate. Its just that you don't expect this class of hotel in the US when there are much nicer hotels across the street for virtually the same price. The lobby is quirky, and the pool is nice enough. The breakfast is probably the best deal in LA. Same is true for the price of parking - very reasonable. I saw many of the rooms because of the nature of the event and the quality varies widely but there are none that I saw that were what I would call acceptable. The rooms are very very dark, no clocks, and a bit on the grim side. Work areas are non-functional. Sheets and mattress pads need to be replaced. Towels are not plush and there is an air of staleness. I had a problem with hot water one morning. Plants were growing inside on the wall of my room- having come through the ouside window. A closed-over elevator ( early 1900's) reminecent of the one I rode on the Tower of Terror was next to our room. There were what appeared to be false doors at the end of the hall leading to what I assume is nowhere. Actually, this is probably just a function of the place being a rehab'd YWCA wherein not all rooms are useable for guests. One door in the hall common area was splintered and appeared to have been broken into recently. I was really glad to get home and have a nice hot shower!

Reviews.Title: “Serving 'the tourist trade' with lyricism and pride”
Reviews.Author: Pernambuco
Reviews.Content: There's the Biltmore, the Standard, and for the rest of us looking to stay in downtown LA, this affordable hotel with free computer access at the lobby desk and a bargain parking garage next door. The Figueroa staff is all-knowing about the city or will find it for you. The location is close enough to downtown's attractions that you can forget the car if you like to walk. The rooms are not only inexpensive and clean, but poetic - how often do those three things happen at once? Every large city should have more like this. Thanks to everyone at Figueroa for making my first LA experience such a happy one. Someone in LA should award you a medal for public service.

Reviews.Title: “A fun, memorable, unique place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bkane
Reviews.Content: Well, an absolute experience. From the unique and international entrance to the bathrooms, the pool, the restaurant and the rooms, this place is so different and unexpected. Truly not your average place. Memorable in every way. The decor is striking, and infinitely better, I think, than newer places that are more corporate and designed by poll. The room (Medina suite) was pretty large, had a city-type view (not much sky or skyline; in fact, mostly roof and outer wall), was painted a dark blue which I found very conducive to sleep. Strong wi-fi signal. Everything worked, and everything - lamps, bedding, chairs - amplified the Moroccan theme. It was a fine place and a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Graceful Step Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: mistertrout
Reviews.Content: If you only frequent the chains and/or upscale hotels, you will find The Figueroa to be a good bit different, not to say that is a bad thing. The entire hotel is based on a Morracan theme, dark and mysterious like a casbah, it is nonetheless immaculate. Each morning there was an army of room maids all dressed in white uniforms awaiting their assignments in the hotel. Our room had two queens with great beds, crisp clean sheets and towels, great water pressure and windows that actually opened! The cafe in the lobby is a la carte buffet and is geared towards the tour bus crowd. Half a block up Figuerora St is the famous Original Pantry diner, open 24/7 and a better diner experience you just won't find, anywhere. So compensate already. The bar and especially the pool area are shielded from the streets of LA by their extensive use of greenery which adds to the quiet and serenity that one hopes to find at a hotel pool. Come with an open mind, step back in time and accept the limits of older hotels and you will be delighted, as we were, with your stay at The FIg.

Reviews.Title: “Ex YMCA and fraudulent use of the word hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alisonengland6
Reviews.Content: Dissapointed by the hotel, staff were unfriendly and did not make eye contact, very dim in reception and corridors not "atmospheric" but dark. Asked for coffee mid morning and was given directions To Starbucks! Rooms were VERY noisy as no double glazing and thin glass so could hear all traffic even though we were at the back of the hotel. No tea and coffee making facilities, no iron and ironing board, no shelf at all for toiletries, really is looking shabby and don't be fooled by "distressed" It is close to the LA convention centre but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Like stepping back in time”
Reviews.Author: rnlane
Reviews.Content: I loved how different the hotel was from the moment we stepped in. It was funny though that we forgot how nice the amenities of a modern hotel are when we wondered where the "ice machine" was! (there is none). It was built in the 20s and you can tell! Our room was lit only by decorative lamps and so it was a bit too dark in the room, we just laughed about it. Overall we really liked it, though for some reason we could really hear the parking lot noise below us but it didn't bother us too much. The only complaint I have is that the jacuzzi and pool closed at 7pm! Who has ever heard of such a thing?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: LTChin
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to see Devo at Club Nokia & surpised me w/an overnight stay at the Hotel Figueroa. From the moment we stepped into the hotel, I was blown away w/the decor, loved the tapestries, lamps & statues. We loved our suite, the Casablanca, couldn't believe the size of the bathtub, it's huge! The staff was great, they were very hospitable. . .gave us suggestions where to have dinner. We had a wonderful time staying at your hotel & that we look forward to coming back soon. . .VERY SOON!!

Reviews.Title: “An exotic retreat in LA”
Reviews.Author: TheSunRunnerMagazine
Reviews.Content: This is the third year in a row that I've stayed at the Figueroa Hotel while working at the nearby LA Times Travel & Adventure Show. I discovered it while hunting for a downtown LA hotel that was within walking distance for the travel show, and now, if I'm staying in that part of LA for the night, it will always be at the Figueroa. The "Fig" is part casbah, part Casablanca, part Silk Road caravan, not your normal hotel, and I mean that in the best way possible. The decor is eclectic, richly colorful, and a very welcome respite from the brash over-the-top noise and crowds of LA "LIVE." There's always an international clientele staying at the Fig, which, when added to the exotic eastern ambience of the place, gives you a feeling of being on a journey, even if you're just going to a game at the Staples Center. The front desk and dining staff are superb, friendly and professional, and the owner of the hotel takes a personal interest in making sure operations are top-notch. Housekeeping always seems excellent as well, the rooms are clean and well supplied. This year, there was a dinner menu in place, which, while limited, was a very good value (especially for downtown), and dining poolside at the Fig is relaxing and delightful (while lines form for overpriced restaurants all around LA Live, you can chill by the pool with a nice New York steak and a great drink from the bar, enjoying your meticulously landscaped surroundings). Breakfast is basic, but reasonably priced, while the legendary "Pantry" is just a block away if you want something more substantial. Downtown can be noisy at times with all that goes on down there, and the nightlife lasts well into the evening, so if you're sensitive to noise, just be advised this is not in the quietest neighborhood in the western hemisphere. The Fig is really, I think, a traveler's hotel. Superior service, cleanliness, a respite from your journey, and a hint of spice and exotic destinations promised along the way. I travel globally, and this is one of my favorite hotels. I highly recommend the Figueroa Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for L.A.”
Reviews.Author: jck0828
Reviews.Content: Figueroa is a steal for L.A. However, rooms are a bit noisy, some aspects feel cheap (towels) and the place is generally a bit creepy (very dimly lit hallways that seem to support the hypothesis that this place is haunted). Still, it's a total bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis Downtown”
Reviews.Author: wherethehellami
Reviews.Content:
Have Stayed here a number of times over the last 15+ years, and I’ve never written a review. I stayed here last in Jan 2011. The Fig never ceases to amaze me. This stylish, under-the-radar riad-of-a-hotel was at the forefront of the boutique hotel scene in the 1990s and it’s still is one of my top 10s anywhere. I come here a few times a year for business and pleasure – Convention Center, Nokia, LA Live are all across the street.

This wasn’t always a great spot – actually just the opposite – but I’ve stayed at the Westin, Hilton, you name it, and this place is now at the epicenter of downtown…shopping, dining and entertainment. Great rates, fun, fashionable and economical accommodations. Cheapest parking downtown that I have found. The Ritz-Carlton charges around $40, parking here is less than half that. Travel a lot and the hotel’s colorful, upbeat pan-Asian/N. African style is a breath of fresh air from the “standardized,” catalogue-fueled digs that are the norm these days. The familial, professional staff is a rarity. And the proprietor is a witty, bright-eyed guy whose inimitable style was one of the initial sparks that helped ignite the whole boutique hotel trend. He always seems to be here, and always seems to have the time to say hello, sometimes share a story. Great stories! The bar and pool areas are highlights, a touch of CB-Demille glamour in the 21st century, and the hot tub is always hot! The unheated pool can be a shock, but the proprietor appears to be holding onto his Swedish heritage – Still, this is LA, not Uppsala. It certainly ain’t the Ritz, but it’s not meant to be. This place is a beacon of old-school hospitality, and one of a small handful of its kind left in the states. It’s ironic that it was a trendsetter when it reopened with its new look, and it is still setting trends today – character driven, reasonably priced accommodations with friendly service in a convenient downtown setting. 3-stars is the new 5-stars! Baring Devid Geffin buying the building, can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay in downtown LA!”
Reviews.Author: Richtraveler01
Reviews.Content: Hotel Figueroa is a treasure in the heart of downtown LA. I have usually opted to stay in boutique hotels near the ocean when vacationing in the LA area. However, Hotel Figueroa’s Moroccan motif gives me that same intimate warm feeling and charm as boutique hotels. My room was clean, spacious and felt very personal for my entire stay. The staff gave me personalized service. They were very friendly and accommodating during my stay. The “don’t miss” area of the hotel is at the pool. I’m a bougainvillea lover and the pool area was covered with these gorgeous vines! The colors are amazing! In the evening the pool area takes on a character of intimacy and bohemian elegance…..it is Moroccan after all! It’s like being in an oasis garden and you’re in the middle of downtown LA! If you like charm, friendliness, and a little exotic décor than this is a great hotel to step out of the predictable.

Reviews.Title: “One night stand”
Reviews.Author: AJewishCowboy
Reviews.Content: After 3 nights at various marriotts is the area decided to try an independent hotel. The economics of this place got me to thinking. It is right next to the staples center and does not look like they put too much back into the property. Having actual keys was a nice retro touch. The front of the building, lobby and decor were sort of a morrocan style and it was fun to walk around. The rooms were pretty funky, but for less than 200 and downtown, were adequate. Showers were awesome. Like I said, good for one night and either it is a goldmine and why bother to spend any money on it, or it is just hanging on and about to become a parking lot. If the kimpton hotel people got a hold on this place it could be amazing. Also, it is a block from the pantry and between the two felt like LA in the 50's. Pantry has great breakast 24x7.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem, Hotel Figueroa.”
Reviews.Author: fundbaby
Reviews.Content: I am an International Flight Attendant and travel the world over. I stay in many hotels for work , most of them chain hotels. When I travel off the clock I try and find places which spark my creative and fantasy side. I have found many a bed and breakfast in exotic places but when back in the States I always find myself going back to the place that makes me peaceful and transports me to another world. This place is in Los Angeles on Figueroa Street. The Hotel Figueroa is just that place. The fact that it was an old YMCA and transformed into a hotel, keeping with the character of the original charm, just blows my mind.
