I had to find out more about this hotel so I asked to see the owner, Uno and he politely and patiently explained almost every detail of the hotel I was fascinated. I have since recommended this Moroccan style motif with a twist , to many of my friends. The pool and bar area is something to amaze at. The décor and bougainvillea’s all over the place just makes it a gardeners paradise. The sunset is something to marvel at. With all the fancy cookie cutter hotels being built all over downtown L.A. it is nice to see something from the past. The staff makes you feel like part of the family when you are there. I consider this my home away from home when traveling to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Oasis in a Concrete Jungle”
Reviews.Author: milllanestudio
Reviews.Content: This charming, Moroccan themed hotel is a welcome oasis in the concrete, steel and glass skyline of downtown LA. With its exotic and unique decor it exudes charm and it has a relaxed ambience, made all the more soothing by the new age music which filters through the hotel lobby. It couldn't be a more perfect hotel for artists and crafters to stay in. My room was large and very clean, and looked just like the pictures on the website. The bathroom was very small but the facilities were adequate. My only complaint is that there is no alarm clock or iron in the room - little things; but I didn't pay for a five star hotel so I am happy with the facilities provided. The pricing offered to our group was excellent value for money, especially given that the hotel is in such close proximity to the LACC and Staples Center. The Figueroa won't be to everyone's taste or everyone's needs, but I loved it's eccentricity. It was a warm and welcome home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - full of Character”
Reviews.Author: CarolynUK
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel after a long journey from London and was pleasantly surprised by the ambience of the place which you feel as you walk in off the street! Yes the room was small - but hey - I was on my own and wasn't paying top rates but it was clean (and immaculately maintained) and the bed was comfortable. I did find it a bit on the noisy side - but its on a busy main road in downtown LA (but a thicker curatin would have helped cut it down considerably. The mini fridge wasn't working during my stay but it stopped me raiding it! The staff were friendly and very helpful at all times and nothing was too much trouble for anyone i had dealings with In answer to the person complaining about lack of wifi - I was able to connect to ATTNET on my laptop and iPhone for a very reasonable $ 5/ day. I really enjoyed my stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to other travellers. If you want a sanitised overcooled concrete box choose one of the big chains which provide the same type of accommodation in any city you may visit - if you want something different with loads of character staffed by real people - try the Figueroa!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing oasis in the middle of concrete and glass jungle, called LA Downtown.”
Reviews.Author: marick_polo
Reviews.Content: I have been coming and staying at Hotel Figueroa for the last 12 years. The Hotel is a refreshing Oasis from the rest of the concrete and glass Jungle of LA Downtown. The rooms are tidy, the beds are comfy, and the decor is very very arty. ( Each room has it's own Moroccan style flair. Try 'Casablanka'! ) If you are looking for Four Seasons on the budget of Holiday Inn, good luck, but Figueroa is the best deal in town specially if you are looking for something Arty and cool. Try the pool side bar Thursday- Sunday night, it's off the hook!

Reviews.Title: “The most laid back and reasonable exotic hotel in Los Angeles!”
Reviews.Author: TheWorldTraveler00
Reviews.Content: The Figueroa Hotel was a delight to experience! I wanted a very reasonably priced hotel since I am in between jobs, and my wife is expecting a baby! We loved the staff, the manager Uno could not have been any nicer! The room was exotic, as we love stained concrete and Persian rugs. The lighting was low and comfortable, and the bed was a beautiful iron made frame with a king size mattress. The Housekeeping was ultra attentive. We were even called by name once we'd been introduced by the manager. The purpose of this trip was all leisure, and it didn't disappoint. While there are no real fancy restaurants in the hotel, the steak and salad and potatoes at night were most tasty, and there was a nice breakfast buffet. Uno, the mgr., also directed us to 4 great places to eat directly across the street at the Staples Center! Also movie theaters nearby there....we never had to drive anywhere. Every restaurant we went to around the area had only high praise for Uno and his staff. The Figueroa was a mix of Moroccan/Mexican/Spanish and Indian styles! Very pleasant! Nice music was piped into the lobby from hidden speakers, and the pool terraces and back bar hosted amazing clients to meet and mingle with...The bartenders were most friendly and made good drinks! They got iced teas and cappuccinos for my wife. The pool was immaculately clean, as was the hotel lobby. I learned that this hotel was a former YWCA and was from the 1920's. The building itself is amazingly in great shape. The walls are concrete and very quiet to sleep in. There was an in-window A/C unit, as central air would've lowered the nicely and artistically painted beamed ceilings. The hallways and rooms were just as advertised, only much more fun due to the service! I will be going back with my wife and newborn son as soon as we have the baby! Bravo Uno on a wonderful hotel experience! Thanks too, to your kind and hospitable staff (some which said they had worked there since 1977!)....Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelsf
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in bridging the gap between a bed & breakfast and the sterility of a chain hotel, look no further. The Hotel Figueroa will charm with you its lush colors, and history. There is a gorgeous patio by the pool that turns into an intimate bar in the evening. Our room was cozy, with detailed touches like the vibrant tapestries on the walls that warmed the room and made me feel I was in a tropical paradise. Close to several good restaurants and situated near downtown LA, it was the perfect spot to spend a night.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel stay of my life.”
Reviews.Author: JKWSEATTLE
Reviews.Content: Seriously, if I had been paying $25 a night, I MIGHT not have been so aghast. From non-functioning lights in the bathroom and closet-like cubicle to total lack of amenities to noise to ancient furniture to dark, dark, dark faux-finished walls (and painted a/c unit) to food smells from the restaurant below, it was hellish. When I checked out, I requested a taxi. The woman at the desk told me to sit and wait and the driver would come in for me. i should have known a buddy would show up, who then tried to charge me $65 for a ride. Horrible. Its only selling point is its proximity to the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic hotel, perfect location, gem amongst modern sameness.”
Reviews.Author: luvstjohn50
Reviews.Content: I truly relaxed here. Walked to/from convention center each day and returned to their peaceful garden of calm. Not like every other cookie-cutter modern hotel. I like them too, but for a change and a GREAT price, choose the Fig. Don't stay here if you are in any way a neat-freak. It's very clean, but it's old and decidedly unique in it's decor. Big clean comfy bed and great old-fashioned tub w/ shower. Not every single luxury you might want (no coffee-maker in rooms, but can get a great cheap cup at their little breakfast nook.) No big-screen TV. Might rethink in hottest months....but it was 90 deg. when I was there and the oldish air conditioner worked fine. Loved this place... Oh, and directly across the street from LA Live...with very easy cheap parking ! Great Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: If you could go back in time about 80 years to a small, rundown, motel in the poorest town of Mexico... Hotel Figueroa would be just that. Here is a list of what you get when you stay at the Hotel Figueroa: no carpet, concrete floors. No bed frame, box and mattress on the floor. Ancient window mounted a/c unit. Very minimal lighting. 12 channels on a 24" television. Thin and scratchy sheets. Small refrigerator with mold. See through curtains with pvc blinds. Windows must be original because they are NOT sound proof at all, which should be essential to downtown L.A. Almost as if there are no windows at all. All in all, this place is really creepy. Location is the only thing that keeps this place in business.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book Here...”
Reviews.Author: mandalough
Reviews.Content: First of all you can't book directly from their website you have to request a reservation. I was given the name of this hotel by a friend who lives in LA. I'm going to LA for my honeymoon in October so went through the normal process on their website. I asked if their was anything I could get that would make my honeymoon more special (thinking most hotels are in the business to make their customers happy). This is what Uno Thimansson (the "owner") told me: "To really make it unforgettable how about twin beds?" OK. I've heard other bad reviews and I suggest you don't book with them. I normally would laugh about this because it's completely stupid but because it's my honeymoon I want to make sure I get a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: anderson99
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel room i have ever stayed in. They are trying to be funky and cool...turns out they're just funky and gross and creepy too.

Reviews.Title: “Run far away as quickly as possible”
Reviews.Author: cbrownx01
Reviews.Content: I can count on one hand the number of times I've checked into and out of a single hotel on the same day; this was one of them. They say the theme is Moroccan, but as far as we could tell, the decor was pulled from numerous defunct Mexical restaurants and haphazardly strewn about. The room was so scary that after checking in and reluctantly getting settled, I set my luggage in the middle of the concrete floor (rather than on the bed or floor rug) in hopes that any existing bed bugs may not be able to leap that far. It was truly awful.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you're getting, and you'll LOVE it!”
Reviews.Author: lizziebarf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Fig today, and absolutely loved it! Yes, it's old, but it is so charming, that if you expect things to be less "modern", all is well! I was entranced from the moment we passed through the gate from the parking lot. Beautiful! Great service at the coffee shop and pool bar, and the front desk was fine. My only big complaint is that the pool closed at 7 pm! I had just come down ready to use the jacuzzi, bought a cocktail at the pool bar, and headed to the front desk for towels when they told me it was closed. I was very disappointed, and headed back out to enjoy the lovely pool area with my husband. Well, as I walked out, there were 4 people in the jacuzzi who had just stepped in. Nobody threw them out, and one of them returned later with pool towels from the front desk. It bothers me that they don't enforce their own rules! My only other gripe is that the rooms need some kind of darkening shades or curtains. The mini blinds and lovely gauzy hangings weren't enough to keep out the morning light. We had a lovely dinner at L.A. Live at Trader Vics (expensive but well worth the food and drinks) and breakfast at the Pantry (cheap but not worth the wait). I will be returning to the Figueroa any time I can make an excuse to be downtown! It is just too charming and lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Funky for sure...”
Reviews.Author: StuartinFiji
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendation of some friends who were attending same show at Convention Centre. It IS located very well for walking to and from the LA Convention Centre. Probably great for weekend in LA if attending a show or sports at STAPLES Center, but certainly not up to to it if you want/need to do business. The weekend we were there was very entertaining as when we returned aftyer dinner on Saturday night there was a full blown Swingers Party in one of the function rroms, and it was spilling (literally) into the foyer!

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Funky at Figueroa”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I was attending a show at the LA Convention Center. Hotel Figueroa was within walking distance and looked a bit funky, so I thought I would give it a go. Glad I did. It is fun and funky. Moroccan theme with a cavernous entry and restaurant. Great touches with their decorations. Bar and pool area looked very inviting (didn't have time to enjoy it myself). Room was very comfortable. Thin windows did bring in a lot of street noise, but since downtown LA is pretty quiet at night, it wasn't a big bother. Restaurant was a combination of a la carte/buffet (pay what you take) and was nice. Directly across from LA Live, with its bars and restaurants, so the location simply can't be beat. If I stay in downtown again, I will return.

Reviews.Title: “I would NEVER recommend and NEVER stay there again”
Reviews.Author: CampingMomma
Reviews.Content: Old Hotel, very eclectic, themish. May greatly appeal to some. I found the management extremely rude and the reservation process was terribly faulty. The room rate was much higher than quoted and contracted. Overall, the room could have been fun if you like old world with limited modern amenities. No outlets in the rooms. No clock. 10 tv channels. No iron. No trash cans. No carpet. The management and staff, however, were rude and abrasive, so we took no pleasure in the ambience of the decorations. The cancelation policy worked well for us as we left early.

Reviews.Title: “unusual & charismatic”
Reviews.Author: cadudio
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in your average boring corporate hotel, stay away. There are lots of places for you. But if you enjoy charismatic funkiness, this is your place. The staff was pleasant, the decor was fun, the room was nice, and the bed was great. Yes, it is old, but that gives the place character. It was a nice and fun place to stay and I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous & Very Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivienned
Reviews.Content: My room was great, but I really lucked out compard to my colleagues. They complained that they had horrible rooms and it was nothing like the pictures we saw. On the other hand, My room was as beautiful as the lobby was. Apparently, since they strive for the uniqueness of the hotel, no two rooms are the same. It was like being in Morrocco or something. It was very exoctic and they had several bars available, which were all great. The mood, ambience, and music was wonderful. Location was excellent; very close to the Staples Center and Nokia LIVE. The hotel is in walking distance to the Macy's shopping center. They only bad things are that you had to pay for EVERYTHING extra like breakfast, internet, etc.. And even though my bed was gorgeous, it was pretty hard including the pillows --- so it was not cozy/comfortable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Figeroa Hotel - Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: papaurn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 day stay at the Figeroa. It is a charming middle eastern styled hotel. In short, I enjoyed my stay there. The hotel is an old building with pretty much everything inside old as well. The bathroom fixtures are old, the closet has old style hooks (the kind some of us used to use in elementary school). Regardless, the hotel is still very charming and attractive. The Fig does not provide the latest and greatest amenities. For instance, the TV has only 15 (or so) channels. I wanted to watch the baseball playoffs but those channels were not available at this hotel. The hotel staff told me that I could purchase wireless internet service (I did not). The room door locks use metal keys as opposed to the electronic cards that are in vogue today. There was no iron/ironing board available in the room. The room was spotless and maintained that way by the hotel staff. I found the front desk staff to be pleasant and cooperative. The hotel is located a short walk from the LA Convention Center, the Nokia Theater, and the Staples Center. There are a number of restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the Staples Center which is about a 5 minute walk from the Fig. The Metro (the subway in LA) is a few minutes walk from the Fig. The subway is clean, safe, and runs frequently. I did not use the Fig's restaurant as their menu is very limited. A number of people did eat there and I never heard any complaints. All in all, the Fig was a very pleasant and enjoyable experience for me. If you're willing to do without the finer amenities you will enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Has character, but very poor facilities & customer service”
Reviews.Author: stevejp95126
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying in LA for 3 nights with my wife. The website for this hotel makes this place look amazing, but in reality the hotel is very old and the rooms/facilities are very dated. The only positive thing about this place is the character - it has some fun decorations and the theme is fun (Mexican/Moroccan). But it is like they are using a band-aid with their "style", to cover up for the fact the place is so old. Bathrooms are old and small - bad drainage, bad shower head with no pressure. The towels were old and paper thin. Didn't appear that any of the rooms had any sort of a view outside - just looked across the building (15 feet or so) into another room. Customer service at front counter was very poor. No one I encountered was friendly and genuinely happy to help you - almost like we were a chore. No services (business, exercise, concessions, etc) Would definitely not stay there again. Wasn't horrible, but I would rather be down the block in the Wilshire........

Reviews.Title: “Depressing.....”
Reviews.Author: LenRotterdam
Reviews.Content: Small room, dark, dirty, no comfort, poor beds, shabby tiny bathroom, ragged towels. Never again in this hotel..... Website shows nice rooms, haven't seen these!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: peanutyoda
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of different hotels in the US but never have I come across a place quite like the Figueroa Hotel in downtown Los Angeles. The hotel's website is informative and shows you exactly what you will get - a cool hotel in downtown LA with an atmosphere way past the ordinary and staff who are helpful and makes you feel very welcome. If you, like me, are tired of the usual hotelrooms which will look the same way wherever you are in the world this is the place for you. Walking distance from the LA Convention Centre as well as the Staples Centre. The rooms are unique and comfy without being showy or luxurious in any way. The Figueroa won't get on its hands and knees and beg you to love it. Its café is not showy but it gives you what you need. The hotel breakfast doesn't bring you pink roses and over the top fruitbowls but it provides a home-ish atmosphere to an affordable price. There is wi-fi to be found at a good price, food shops just around the corner and great restaurants within a minute's walking distance. If you'd like to see something different whether you are on a business trip or just on vacation I would recommend the Figueroa any day of the week. If you're arranging a reception, then even better. The setting of the hotel is appealing to any culture or group of people. Rarely have I enjoyed a hotel stay this much and I know that the next time I go to LA I'll know exactly where to stay! Hey, I'd even settle my travel dates for when my favourite room was available.

Reviews.Title: “overrated but nice”
Reviews.Author: lord-of-the-trips
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely overrated. The internet gives the impression of a very stylish hotel with strong arabic-moroccan flair. In reality the rooms are extremely small (at least my one is), it is all far away from being modern (the electricity leaves a lot to be desired in terms of secured wiring), the bathroom is the narrowest I ever saw. And the window (which is completely wired) only looks to a 4-5m narrow inner court. But everything is clean and ok, painting is nice but far from spectacular. The price is too much if you compare it to Marriotts or others. Amenities are a joke (one small plastic tube of shower gel and a small soap bar is all you get; no hair dryer, no shoe shine, no lotion, no nothing). No gym and noone in his right mind would jog there given the traffic (that would be like smoking two packages of cigarettes in a row). The food in the lobby bar is not worth the money. Chicken burned, burger rather tasteless, the breakfast is very low level (dry buns, no bagels, everything charged extra, no fresh fruit...) However, whereas other stated it was noisy I cannot confirm that. At least in may 2009, there is no construction side nearby. All in all, much overrated and compared to the price the motel6 in Hollywood is maybe a much better deal, certainly if travelling with more than one person.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want a gorgeous unique hotel that's not cookie cutter”
Reviews.Author: rutsaLA
Reviews.Content: I had been to the bar at the Fig before so I knew already that I loved the atmosphere and decor the hotel has going on. The show Alias used this place as its Morocco. When we were at the bar, the pool was calling to me. But unlike some other L.A. hotels (like the Standard) it is guests only. So we knew one day we'd do a "staycation" here. The event was our anniversary. The owner (I presume - he was French and I remembered some reviews here describing him as such) took my booking. Our main thing was we had only one night to spend and we wanted full advantage of the pool but with a usual 3pm check in & 11-noon check out it didn't really leave us much daytime as official guests. Well the owner offered unsolicited to give us an early check in (noon), late check out (2pm) AND let us use the pool the whole next day. Sold! Very very nice of him. He asked if we'd like a "dark" room. I said to book us in whatever would be romantic. He gave us the "Prince" room (#125). It was the base rate, around $150 + tax and + parking. I cannot even describe how much I loved it. Purple, BIG, 2 closets, gorgeous furniture, canopy bed, beautiful bathroom. Some people have talked about dingy rooms. Well I can tell you the bathroom was entirely spotless - it looked like everything was just caulked and grouted that day. There was a cool farm sink too - separate hot and cold taps but I'm down with old funky things like that. There were 2 downsides to my long-awaited pool experience. 1. no lounge chairs. Just metal cafe ones. I get that they have a big bar scene at night and need space for people but it was a downer not to stretch out. 2. the pool & spa close at 8pm. Again this is probably for bar biz. But we wanted to use the hot tub at night! wah wah wah Oh and one more, the water was pretty frigid. Not heated. But it was still gorgeous and the spa made up for it. It was also a little hard to get ice. I assume this is b/c they try the whole "no outside food" thing. But I smuggled stuff in. We also spent $70 or so at the bar & restaurant so I feel no guilt over this. The mojitos at the bar are stellar. We tried both the burger & the tomato pasta from the restaurant and both were satisfying, especially the pasta. Not grade A but the Original Pantry next door (supposedly a city favorite) turned us way off and this was a much better alternative. Plus we got to eat by the pool with a cold beer. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat, and I'd want that room. If you are into exotic, and a little funky come here. If you are into Sheraton watercolor-decorated rooms with a in-room coffee, don't come here. If you need room service don't come here.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyHfromTOaks
Reviews.Content: Okay, the hotel is not an oasis like the website may suggest, but it is not a rat hole either. It is a very old hotel in a very old building. Our room was very clean. Period. The bed was very comfortable. The TV had cable, but no movies or pornos. The key is metal, not magnetic like in new hotels. So what? The decor is so elaborate. All of the walls inside are painted in a style reminiscent of old Spain, Mexico or Morocco. The rooms are decorated beautifully. If you like to stay primarily in Hiltons, Sheratons or Marriotts, then this is not your place. Stay at this place for one night and you will think you are in a foreign country.

Reviews.Title: “Like no other hotel in the US”
Reviews.Author: missucali
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at A LOT of fabulous hotels throughout Southern California & enjoyed being pampered at some of LA's ultimate luxury stays but if you want something that will truly make you feel you landed in some exotic, far away place.... Figueroa Hotel!! Smack in the middle of downtown Los Angeles (the epitome of concrete jungles) is a hotel that instantly begins to feed your senses w/the richest fabrics draping floor to ceiling (which is about 3 stories high in some parts of the lobby & lounge areas) nothing in this entire hotel lacks detail or expression. There's nothing about this place that says 'L.A.' though almost all of the guests that stay there actually live in LA! It's vibe is rich, sexy, mysterious. It has a touch of Gypsy feel to it as well with the jeweled eclectic & eccentric decor. They offer a number of Suites & of course no 2 are alike. Matter of fact, I don't think any 2 rooms in the hotel are alike. It's not somewhere that you're gonna get pampered w/the latest micro-peel... whatever-it's not that place at all. You'll fall in love with the pool at 1st sight!!! Please make it a point, even just for a couple days, to go & experience this mystical, beautiful & completely authentic Moroccan gem! It's surprisingly affordable as well! Book in advance, the weekends are had to book last minute. Here's their website: www.figueroahotel.com. It is going to take you to another place & time! highly recommend for a romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “A Step Back in Time...”
Reviews.Author: SoniCido
Reviews.Content: The Historic Figueroa (Fig-you-roar-AH) Hotel in Downtown Los Angeles, California. My roommate chose this hotel for herself, my daughter and me because of it being the closest walking distance (about 2-3 blocks) to the L.A. Convention Center (we attended the 2008 Screenwriter's EXPO). She also told me it was a neat atmosphere. When I read negative reviews I became nervous about spending over $100 a night for what the reviews were saying. I decided to go with the positive reviews which included my roommate's and take a chance. How bad could it be? after all, I've stayed in Youth Hostels in Europe. I was thrilled when I arrived in the rear parking lot to enter through a long corridor/out door court yard which was filled with plants, color and beautiful tiles. We had to park in the car wash parking lot (next to Figueroa lot) as there was a Wedding party taking over the hotel parking lot. Figueroa gave us a parking pass as they have an agreement with the car wash; so don't panic if you have to park there. Go get a pass at the front desk. The staff were friendly and the service perfect. The men cooking and serving breakfast were sweet and very helpful. Everyone was always smiling! Yes, the rooms had no carpet, and looked kind of "old world" but that is the POINT. The water pressure in the shower was better than most hotels I frequent. If you want CUSH do not stay at the Figueroa. If you want historic ambiance (similar to a Tombstone Arizona B & B) and convenience to the Convention Center- then the Figueroa delivers more than you can imagine. The colors, lighting, decor, dressed employees, out door lounge and pool area-took me into a world that I wanted to stay in longer. My only complaint? (no 5 Star rating here) No coffee pots in the rooms, signs up "Do Not bring in outside food or beverages" (yet they provide refrigerators hidden in the Television Armior and no one gave me trouble about having a cooler full of food for sack lunches and dinner); AND I did not like having to pay for a breakfast. They could at least offer free coffee and bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Unique Ambience”
Reviews.Author: debsline
Reviews.Content: First off, I am sorry I read the negative reviews on this site...they really frightened me. When my husband surprised me with this trip I looked here for a heads-up to the hotel to see the amenities. We were going to the Staples Center and it was very close. Is this a hotel for those used to all the 'extras'? NO! But is it perfect for those of us tired of the same old four walls...YES! The ambience was great...including the silk on the walls and the tapestry on the floor. Yes, the bathroom was on the old side, but it wasn't 'disgusting' like another reviewer said. We found the beds to be quite comfortable even though I had to climb onto it (I am kinda short and with two box springs and a mattress, once I was up...I didn't come down until morning:) The weather was a bit warm and we kept the air conditioning unit on all day and night. And for those who complained about the concrete floors...they were nice and cool on the feet after walking around all day. I for one will be coming back. It was a wonderful change from the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Crack heads live better”
Reviews.Author: miikey_187
Reviews.Content: ok well where to start hotel figueroa is most definatly a tourist trap unless your going to a convention or a concert or something in the general facility your stuck in the middle of no where unless you want to dish out $100 dollars a cab ride if your lucky you can ride to metro if there is room with the hallways smelling like something died the room was no better cracked floors with minimal repair multiple colored walls poor lighting 13 channels not really much of a selection windows with minimal view unless u like looking at more brick wall and parking lot and the occasional homeless the washroom was tight and cramped poor lighting something out of a slasher flick toilet had a sanitized sticker on it bowl had something at the bottom mildew like substance forming on the window beds were stiff i dared not take a black light to them cafe menu was another thing that could have used improvement food was mediocore bar was over priced and the bar was a joke over priced limited selection i may be coming off a little strong with this review but truth must be told the website is a lie unless u feel like shelling out the extra money for a so called theme room every part the hotel is dark if your looking to stay some where there is a holiday inn 1/2 a block up the road still in the same area

Reviews.Title: “Fab Figueroa”
Reviews.Author: mottrex
Reviews.Content: Just got back from LA after staying in Figueroa Hotel for two weeks. Myself my son of 14 and my 9 year old daughter. We wanted somewhere in LA which was both central to the surrounding areas and depicted local charm of the historic area. We were not disapointed,the hotel has a beautiful morocan/mexican feel to it. With many colourful and varied rooms,full of textures and objects to gaze over. It cetainly has a laid back charm,and is also part of the LA sky line as well. It has the added feature of a pool surrounded by lush cacti and ornate features which make this a Garden of Paradise in this sprawling Downtown area of LA. The bedroom was a bit small but we only used it for sleeping as we were out all day exploring the city. It was nice to stay in a builing with character and not the usual plastic fasade with plastic people in them. LA is undergoing a huge redevelopment at the moment so there is a level of noise polution which did not effect us. The staff were very helpful and alway's helped us if we were stuck or needed assistance. The staff were well presented and looked great in there Kaftans. and white tunics. The pool was sometimes closed for private functions but notices were posted well in advance. The breakfast bar was open 6 - late which meant we could get up earley eat then head off before the rush hour traffic ,which is not that bad ( do take Sat Nav it so helps) The the Restaurant opens 7 till late serving decent evening meals which the children can eat . A safety deposit box is avaliable at no charge and is avaliable anytime. Car Parking is situated to the rear of the building and is well lit and enclosed. We all loved the hotel and would go back again as it ticks lots of boxes for us. TRG.

Reviews.Title: “A treat for the brave”
Reviews.Author: zing0000
Reviews.Content: Do you like clinical, predictable, have-a-nice-day hotels? Well, thank goodness not everyone does because the Figueroa is a treat for the brave. It definitely has seen better times, I wish they would light the rooms so you can see the color - but it's not about trying to replicate an 800 thread-count prison room, this place has charm, and the minimal staff are lovely! A restoration is needed but then it would be $400/night like the other prison rooms in major hotels. If you are in LA, particularly going to Convention Center - this is a treat for the brave!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: akimball
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I was 5 months pregnant at the time and by myself.............it was perfect. Old...yes.............but beautiful . Great breakfast, great service and the rooms were entirely comfortable. I recommend it highly for the traveler who wants something unique, safe and engaging. I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Hakaider
Reviews.Content: This is not an exagerration. Avoid the Figueroa Hotel at all costs at all future events. I did not always believe the horror stories about this hotel until we checked in. I had thought that this would be a one star-Motel 6 type of motel. Unfortunately, it was far, far worse than a Motel 6. Normally I don't even mind sleeping in a Motel 6, as long as it's sanitary and clean. ( I've been to hotels in other countries, as well as the Midwest and East Coast in the U.S. ) This was one of the worst hotels that I ever been in my life. Due to the proximity of the location to the LA Convention Center, I had booked this hotel for an Anime Expo Convention at the LA Convention Center. When my roomates and I checked in at the Figueroa Hotel at Day 1 of the convention, we were appalled when we entered room #318. This what we found in the room: (There were other things as well, but these were the most appalling parts.) 1. The hotel room floor-It was not carpeted and a plain floor. There were various cracks everywhere in the floor. (Some were large enough for you to stub your toe or trip over.) Also the floor was filthy. When you walk barefoot on the floor, the soles of your feet became black with dirt & hair. The room was quite dirty and there was dust everywhere. Even in the tables. The wooden chair facing the table was broken and left unfixed. 2. Rest room: There were cockroaches running across the bathtub and toilet seat. The toilet seat's was chipped and it was hard to flush. The Bathtube/shower-The worst part. The bathtub was not a flat surface and strangely curved in a steep angle. Once the shower is turned on, it becomes very slippery and I fell down 3 times. (When I tried to get back up I would slip and fall again.) The fall had bruised and strained my back. I had to see a masseur, (Spent $99) in another hotel to help ease the back pain. ( I had to see my doctor after the con was over and he prescribed me diclofenac sodium for the pain.) My 2 roomates also said that they almost slipped and fell inside the bathtub. The shower would also turn suddenly hot and then suddenly cold. When I complained to the manager, Uno about the situation, he was very rude and tried to argue with me. He refused to apologize and tried to shift the blame on me for falling down. One of his responses was " The bathtub is 85 years old. What do want me to do about it?" The hotel manager never once apologized, never bothered to call or come to see if we were O.K., and just didn't care whether we stayed or not. The room situation had gotten so bad that we all checked out in the morning after the 2nd day of the convention and checked in the Wilshire Grand. (An excellent classy hotel with great service. Plus the price difference as compared to what the Figueroa Hotel was quite minimal.) I just want to caution anyone who are thinking about booking at the Figueroa Hotel in AX 2009. In some cities, this hotel would have been condemmed by the city due to lack of health standards. Since this hotel is privately owned and not part of a hotel chain, it makes me wonder what the fire marshal or health inspector would find if they pay this hotel a surprise visit. (Having cockroaches running around the restroom and hotel room are a good indication that it is not up to the current heath standards.) This is a health and safety issue, and this should be a hotel that you would only book at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterLouisville
Reviews.Content: The website is VERY deceiving. Online the hotel looks beautiful, but then you walk into your guest room... scary. There is no alarm clock, very limited TV channels, the box spring sits on the floor with 2 mattresses above it. The a/c unit is in the window. The only drapes are sheers that block no sunlight. At night, you can turn on all the lamps and not be able to read a book. The closets smell like mildew. You can't book the hotel online b/c they are stuck in 1950 with real keys and scary plumbing. The pool area is nice, but to lay out you have to lay on the concrete. The lobby is pretty and the bar area is nice. Good hotel to hang out in, but sleep somewhere else. The sad part is, of three people at the hotel I knew, I had the nicest room and I was scared for my safety the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made me want to VOM!”
Reviews.Author: Jamesy121
Reviews.Content: On a scale from one to ten, with ten being comparable to staying in a cardboard box on the sidewalk and 1 being comparable to staying at the Ritz Carlton, I would rate this hotel at a 9.5. The rooms were loud, poorly ventilated and poorly air conditioned. The sheets on the bed had a sour odor. At 5 a.m. the street noise was so bad, I actually got up to check if the maid had "accidentally" left the window open (she had not - the windows were just that thin). The staff, donning their Moroccan-themed uniforms, could have not have been more unhelpful. The shower was built for a little person and there was a Mexican blanket stapled to the wall....need I say more? Do not be fooled by the "boutique" description and inviting, however possibly professionally retouched photos - this hotel is a DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic, charming, unique, not 'done' yet”
Reviews.Author: gotamojo
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a sweet hotel that has loads of character, stay here. If you require all the modern amenities of a brand new or completely redone hotel property, stay somewhere else. I had an excellent three-night stay at the Fig and felt the richer for it when I left. The hotel retains much of its original 1920s charm. It may appear worn to some because it has not had a multi-million dollar makeover. What you get instead is the experience of a one of a kind hotel, still maintained in a style that is disappearing. The lobby, bar, and swimming pool area are extraordinary; you won't find them anywhere else in downtown LA, and a lot of people hang out there for that reason. My room was small, somewhat stuffy, and altogether delightful. The hotel is clean. The staff is attentive, not trained to be professionally friendly. The staff of the extremely limited cafe made up for it by being uniformly helpful and kind. I highly recommend the Fig to anyone who is desperate to break free of the formulas that hoteliers increasing impose on us.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy comes to mind”
Reviews.Author: lala5901
Reviews.Content: I was booked in the "Fig" for a convention, so I had no say in the reservation. It is very convenient to the convention center-within walking distance. And that is all that can be said on a positive note. The hotel does not have central air-only window units which are noisy and dirty. The corridors and the room had a dry mold smell. Our room had carpet that was filthy and smelled. The outside walls of the buildings adjacent are used as allnight billboards with bright lights-we had to hang multiple articles of clothing to block the light coming through the sheer curtains. There is one small bath towel per person. The staff was not friendly-not rude-just indifferent to everything. The manager is invisible. We moved after one night.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved the Figueroa!”
Reviews.Author: Traceldel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Figueroa Hotel for 5 nights while I was in LA for the AWHONN annual convention. The location couldn't have been more convenient for the LA convention center. I found the hotel to be charming, quirky, and a bit funky. The decor is beautiful. My room was comfortable and well decorated in the hotel's Moroccan casbah style. The breakfast buffet was inexpensive, convenient, and exactly what I needed before I dashed out to a full day conference. The pool area is gorgeous. I found the service to be adequate and the staff friendly. This is NOT a Hilton, Holiday Inn or any other chain hotel. It is not a luxury hotel. It is a lovingly remodeled former YWCA built in 1925. The sometimes inconvenient layouts of the rooms, particularly the bathrooms, reflect it's history. It reminded me of traveling in Europe and stumbling upon a unique, marvelous little hotel that know one knows about. It definitely has personality! Uno, the owner, while reserved in a professional, European way, was charming and couldn't have been nicer. If you are looking for a modern, corporate chain hotel where you already know exactly what you can expect from every one in the world, you probably won't be happy here. If you want a unique experience in an otherwise homogenized world, then the "Fig" may be just right for you.

Reviews.Title: “strange behavior with customers”
Reviews.Author: willy005
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from june 14th to 19th. room 227 for a convention. I have been charged 184 $ per night for a room that should be charge at less than 100$. When I was trying to unplug my computer, I unfortunately broke an morocan pot, I went to inform the manager of the hotel, and the guy insulted me and also charged me of 450$. I cannot recommand this hotel to anyone, rooms and bed are not clean, you have a lot of noise coming into the room, as the windows are not well closed, the air conditionner doenot work and as the exterior walls are use to make advertisement, the ligth from the big projectors are in your room. This hotel should close its dors and get renovations Guillaume JOHNSON

Reviews.Title: “Figueroa Hotel, it's not all about the looks”
Reviews.Author: MrSmid
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Figueroa Hotel we were amazed by it's interior, a realy nice decoration and nice warm colours. But we soon got disappointed when we met the staff. They were the unfriendliest people we have met during our trip through the USA. The room had a realy loud airconditioning, so we had to shut it down when we went to sleep, so we didn't sleep good at all beacause it was too warm. The badroom was alright, don't expect too much confort while showering here, and clean. But that was the only good thing about this hotel. Los Angeles is a nice city to stay, but when you choose to stay there, don't choose the Figueroa Hotel, it will make your visit to the city of angels a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Heed the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: jciaramella
Reviews.Content: I am fresh from a Figueroa Hotel stay of one week. I braved it only because we were attending a Nursing convention and everything else was booked early on. It is convenient to the Convention Center(truly comfortable walking distance) and to The Pantry, a great diner for breakfast (best coffee). Aside from the pool, there are no amenities here. If a bar of soap each day and towels with no nap left are amenities to you go here. The staff is indifferent to the guests. The pool was ok but no lounge chairs. They have private parties at night so guests cannot even use the pool at that time. The first room we were given had a stong smell of urine. We requested a change and after trying to offer excuses as to why it might have happened (who cares) they did switch the room to a larger one. It had a small refrigerator. he phones did not work and the cold water handle in the shower would not turn well. All in all we made the best of it and will forever have laughs about our stay here during the convention, but try to find something else that you will enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Dug this Spot”
Reviews.Author: pghonthegogo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before I read some rather negative reviews, so I was a bit nervous about what I was in store. I had no problems at all. Althought the staff is not friendly, I didn't find them rude either. Just, well, indifferent. I will say I loved my room! It was decorated perfectly, comfy king-sized bed, clean and of a good size. It was a bit on the dark side, in regards to the lighting, and the door lock seemed a little peculiar. Nonetheless, I had no problems. My one suggestion would be the installation of more lighting, as it can be difficult to see in the sitting area of the room. The vibe of the Figueroa was unique. I traveled alone and was undisturbed by a single soul. I did my research in advance, so I didn't need to ask the reputededly rude staff any questions. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience, avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: minniecalifornia
Reviews.Content: Heed the reviews of this hotel that comment on the terrible services. They are not lying. I've stayed at shabby hotels in third world countries that I thoroughly enjoyed because of the excellent service. The Figueroa would be a nice hotel, were it not for the service. It began right when we checked in. I had called a few days before to request an early check-in time. I understand that it cannot be guaranteed. So when we arrived and were told that the room was not yet ready, we were happy to wait. However, the couple right behind us were told the room was not ready, but Uno (the owner/operator) told the lady at the front desk to find a room that was ready for the couple, and somehow there was a room ready. The front desk lady did not make any attempt to do the same for us, though we were still standing near the front desk. From then on we got nothing but rudeness and attitude from the staff. After dinner and a show, we returned to the hotel to sit in the jacuzzi. There was a very loud private party at the hotel. So we were not allowed to use the pool area or the bar by the pool, even though we were paying guests. When I complained about this the lady at the front desk told me I should have asked if there was going to be a party the night we were staying there, as if I am supposed to assume that a party is going to prevent me from using the facilities that I am paying for. Then a boy got about five inches from my face and told me that I have no right to complain or talk to the front desk lady that way, even though she was the one being rude. When I asked this boy (he had a uniform on, so he did work there) who he was to tell me I cannot complain, he scampered away. There were at least two other people at the front desk behind that I overheard waiting to complain about the pool being closed and the hotel policy of "No outside food or drink allowed in the hotel." Later that night our TV was not working, so they sent the same boy that seemed to try to start a fight with me an hour earlier. They must have thought that was funny. Of course I told him to leave our room so as to avoid any incident. We were told that Uno would be at the hotel at 8:00 Sunday morning and we could discuss our complaints with him then. When we checked out at 9:30 Sunday morning, Uno had not yet been at the hotel and the lady at the front desk said he may not be in. I called the next day and spoke to Uno. I told him that I have some concerns about how we, as paying guests, were treated during our stay. He asked me if I wanted him to weep for me. I'm not sure what he meant by that, but didn't think it was a good start when he had a very disappointed customer. He asked for my name and room number. When I gave it to him he said his staff had told him about me and said that I was rude and would not listen to reason. I tried to explain to him that I was not really getting any good reasons for the poor service I received. We discussed the pool being closed. Uno said that his insurance company told him to close it at 7:00 because it was dark and people may get hurt using it after sunset. (So make it safer?) I agreed that insurance is a good reason for that. But also said that is not the reason I was given when I tried to address this with the front desk (they mentioned the private party) and also there are no signs on the premises or on the website indicating that the pool area closes at 7:00. I said that my wife and I chose the Figueroa partly because we wanted to use the jacuzzi and so we paid for something that we did not have access to. Uno said that he did not think that makes sense. He brought up the fact that I did not let the boy in to look at our TV when the hotel sent him. I admitted to this and described, again, the how the boy approached me earlier. Uno said the boy was not trying to start a fight. I tried to say that he took an aggressice stance and got very close to my face, but Uno cut me off saying that I had been doing all the talking so far (though he had done just as much). He repeated that the boy was not trying to start anything with me (and perhaps he wasn't, but certainly approached me like he was) and that if his staff was rude to me it was my fault. This conversation with Uno ended with him saying he would like to terminate this converation, for some reason thanking me, then hanging up. This conversation with Uno certainly showed that he sets the standard when it comes to rudeness and disrespect among his hotel staff. Adding to the poor service, the beds are hard as boards and the showers don't work very well. The rooms are adequate, but not worth what you pay. Again, DO NOT STAY HERE. Pay a few extra bucks and stay at the Holiday Inn a block away.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: yummychk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Figueroa is not your average hotel, but very unique in its own right. The lobby area was very exotic with huge chairs and small coffee tables for casual conversation. We had a quick dinner that was not too impressive because of the extremely limited items on the menu. We were expecting a more exotic menu of Moroccan food since that is the theme of the hotel. The bar and pool area was fantastic! Very swanky, very hip, great bartenders and the highlight of our stay! We were in number 416. It was very small with a king bed. No alarm clock or coffee maker, but lots of charm! Bed was comfortable and the place was very clean. Bathroom was extremely small and had no vent or fan for the shower. The staff was very professional and helpful. Short walk to Staples Center and the new Nokia theater. If you are looking for a place to stay downtown and you want ambiance, than this is the place for you, but if you are looking for someplace more high end, than this is NOT the place for you. I had read reviews of this hotel and was a bit worried, but when we parked in their parking lot and came through the pool/bar area, I knew that we were going to have a great time. I don't understand what all these people previously were griping about.

Reviews.Title: “Surly to say the least”
Reviews.Author: mosley
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay here but I visited a friend who did. Both times we had terrible experiences with the staff. We are the kind of people who don't take initial rudeness personally -anyone can be having a bad day- and respond cordially. Both times we received even more no eye-contact surliness in return. That's simply inexcusable from a place of business. The lobby is unique, but don't look too closely, it's not that well done.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST Hotel Room in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: dklein
Reviews.Content: I heard about this place either on T.V. or reading 'Travel & Leisure' or 'Conde Naste Traverler' magazines and it sounded incredible. Living in Los Angeles ourselves (my wife and I), we don't get too many opportunities to stay in hotels in the city. But we do stay in a lot of hotels across the world and I do a ton of research, so take our word for it, THIS PLACE IS AN ABSOLUTE MUST. While we splurged on the Casablance suite (room #100), I made a point of checking out a friend's room since I had read some pretty God-awful reviews in here. In fact, some of the reviews were so bad that I hesitated booking a room for my wif'es 35th birthday. I even considered canceling my booking like another reviewer here. Up until entering the room after checking in, despite how cool the lobby was, I was very concerned but decided to realize that this place wouldn't be in both 'Travel & Leisure' and 'Conde Naste Traveler' magazines if it wasn't special. It's also in a handful of other publications with decent reviews. And special it certainly is. If we booked a suite (not to mention the hotel's biggest & best) anywhere else downtown, we'd be paying $700 and up. Easy. In February for my birthday, we got the penthouse at the Standard Downtown for 1/2 price (booking the night of) for $500 (normal price was $1,000). We paid $245 for the Figueroa and it was a great deal. Out on the street, you walk up to the door wondering where the valet is and what kind of dump this place could be. It certainly doesn't look like much from the front. Parking is directly behind the hotel, piece of cake. To save you some time, pull up in the back instead of the front when you check in. Once you enter, you're swept away to Morocco. The lobby, restaurant and various bars on two levels were absolutely breathtaking. I felt like a little kid at Disneyland, running around to check out all that there is to see. The pool is beautiful with its own bar out back. We had a great time hanging out here with friends after we grabbed dinner up the street at Nick & Stef's (spectacular steak). The room...where do I begin?? You enter the Casablanca suite and you expect to see princes and princesses recling on the sofa or bed or sitting on the bench/trunk near the window. The decor is sultry, sexy and so much fun. The room is huge and the bathroom....the tub is a concrete swimming pool with a rain shower head above you. It's wonderful. The second we stepped into this room, I knew I was going to be sorry it was only for one night and we had an early morning the next morning. If you're looking for a room with a view, forget it. The view IS your room. There's a small window to let in light (and air I imagine), but of course, any added light would take away from the warm, cozy Arabian theme. There's good air conditioning and it was a warm L.A. day and night. We had a bar area with a fridge and coffemaker. There's a T.V. if you need one and the bed is amazingly comfy. The quilt is so big and fluffy it looked as if someone was sleeping in our bed. While the pool bar is hopping and definitely worth grabbing a drink at, I thought having our room right next to the upstairs bar might cause some commotion that would make sleeping difficult. Nope. I don't believe they even opened the bar outside our door and the lobby was surprisingly quiet. Now for the standard room....I have no clue how many bad reviews I read before deciding to stay here. The room I saw, up on the 7th floor (we had 2 sets of friends staying in 2 rooms on the same night), was a perfectly good standard room. Okay, the floor is concrete (painted) but the room was cozy, clean and cool. The theme from downstairs is even continued up into these smaller rooms with interesting colors, furniture and furnishings. There's a fridge, A/C and T.V. and the bed looked very comfortable and clean. I just don't understand how you could give this place a bad review. The bathroom was clean...i even checked out the tub, which was clean and in perfectly good, working order. I believe our friends paid $140 for their room. Average for downtown I believe. For the same price, my wife and I stayed at the Bonaventure in June for a wedding and while it was nice, if you wanted to be picky about some things, it certainly wasn't perfect. I was pleased with it, and certainly more pleased with the Fig. You don't stay at the Fig if you're looking for the Ritz. And if you're looking for the Ritz, you're going to pay a lot more. If you're looking for a very cool, funky, clean and inexpensive place to stay downtown, this place is AWESOME. We never had any trouble with management and checking in and out was a breeze. Sure, they have a policy as do any of the other hotels against having parties in your room. And they assume, rightly so, that if you're inviting people up to your room, you're inviting them to have a party. Let's be realistic here. What else would you be doing? The Figueroa makes it very clear that they don't approve of parties when they give you a paper to sign upon checking in. Any other hotel makes you do the same thing, you just don't know you're agreeing to not having parties in your room. Check the back of your checkin contract (or the small print). Or ask. As for throwing parties in your room, I actually have quite a bit of experience with this. Like anywhere else, I imagine you CAN have people up to your room as long as you're mature and respectful about it. If you're boozin' it up and causing a lot of rucous (and being obvious about it), you're going to get booted. If you're quiet and have a nice group of people over (not a mob) and having a beer or a glass of wine up in your room, I'm sure you'd be fine. But then again, on a nice night like it was this weekend, why would you stay in your room? And just remember, you're staying in a hotel. You're expected to be mindful of other guests. If you have more people in your room, you're bound to disturb your neighbors. I'm a fun loving guy but a light sleeper. I've been woken up a number of times by noisy neighbors. Anyway, I plan on staying at the Figueroa Hotel again. Absolutely, no question. I will be recommending this place to everyone I know. If you want a fun and unique night out on the town, this is a great place at which to finish. Pictures to come so you can see what I'm talking about!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: littlemeow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful, I will give them that much, but they have the WORST customer service I have ever experienced! I have stayed at many many hotels over the years, I travel alot. Well I dyed my hair a week before my stay, and as a result when i showered a little bit of the leftover dye came out onto the towel and a pillowcase. No big deal bleach takes it right out. what I didn't expect was to get a phonecall within an hour of leaving being YELLED at by the management and being reprimanded as if I was a 12 year old child! In all the years I have spent traveling and staying at dozen upon dozens of hotels I have never trashed a single one and I have never received a phonecall being yelled at by management. And no not just angry, this guy laid into me as soon as I answered the phone!!!! I will never stay there again!!! The rudest group of people I have ever experienced at a hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel - "Hotel California-esque" in the middle of LA”
Reviews.Author: 123wanderer
Reviews.Content: I was going to a conference at Staples Center and wanted a hotel within walking distance. Hotel Figueroa came up and I read Frommer's review, which was good. I booked a room with the owner, Uno. Very pleasant and helpful. I then read some very disturbing reviews of the hotel. I ended up cancelling the reservation, but thought twice, and rebooked it because it sounded so unique. I could have booked the Holiday Inn across the street - but when you are tired of sameness, sometimes unique is the right choice. It turned out to be charming. I have done a great deal of global travel and wanted that feel. The other guests were a combination of other nationalities, as they seem more willing to allow for quirky simplicity. The room had terracotta painted walls, matching stained cement floor and lots of other color in sari-covered windows, Indian rug wallhangings and a lovely wrought-iron covered bed. Simple and comforting. The staff was friendly. I was up at 6am and went downstairs to find a satisfying breakfast buffet - alacart. 50 cent pancakes, $1.50 for bacon or sausage -- etc. Including coffee, my $5.00 breakfast was just right. I walked by at 10am on a Sunday morning and found the restaurant full with lots of people enjoying overflowing plates. The pool and restaurant are also inviting. If you are a seasoned traveler, you will enjoy the charm, color and atmosphere. It's convenient to downtown and the DASH 25 cent buses. Take a chance - make your own decision. Don't let a few unsatisfied customers keep you from something different. Crystal - Psychologist

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: magwum
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Figueroa is not your average hotel. It is not "above average", but is best described as "unique". The lobby area was very exotic. Great place with comfy chairs to talk to others and chill out after a long day. Ala-carte breakfast was pretty decent. Coffee was very good! Dinner was not too impressive - very limited menu, but La Bella Cucina next door and the Panty Cafe a short walk away more than makes up for it. The bar and pool area was fantastic! Very exotic, very hip, and the highlight of our stay! Our room, Number 401, was very small with two twin beds. No alarm clock or coffee maker, but lots of charm! Beds were very comfortable and the place was very clean. Bathroom was very small and had no vent or fan. Room got pretty steamy after a shower. Staff was very professional and helpful. Short walk to the convention center. All and all, a decent hotel - but do not expect the level of comfort most Americans now expect even from your typical discount motel chain. If you want your hotel to have a lot of character, then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Run away, don't walk!”
Reviews.Author: Scott771
Reviews.Content: What a joke! Booked this hotel because we attended the Pac 10 Men's Basketball Tournament and wanted to be close to the Staples Center. Other than it's close proximity to the Staples, I have absolutely NOTHING good to report on this Hotel. The Hotel is old! The interior is dark. There was LOUD Moroccan music playing all the time in the lobby. The desk person was not personable at all. The pay per parking lot is in behind an alleyway on the backside of the Hotel. I felt very unsafe going to the car at night. The room was ridiculous! The carpet was worn out, in fact, after removing my shoes and heading to the bathroom, I stepped on a nail poking up through the carpet tack strip at the bathroom floor transition!. The bath/shower had cracked caulking in the tub to tile on the walls and the floor. There were 2 old valve handles in the shower that had been removed and hadn't even been capped off in behind the wall, they were just sticking through! The existing water hot water handle was in reverse order, and to top it off, after I got the shower going, I found myself standing in a couple of inches water! Slow to drain. The towels were on a rack directly over the toilet, and yet the toilet had no closed toilet seat. There was a dark narrow closet, an armoire with broken handles and a television with only 12 basic channels. No ESPN or anything. I called a AAA travel Agent the and asked if they could book me somewhere else. They made reservations for me at the Marriott, 6 blocks away, for $15.00 a night more. The difference was as stark as day is from night. Have I painted a clear enough picture for you?

Reviews.Title: “Funky Design, Barly better than a backpackers, Affordable though.”
Reviews.Author: ornerygoat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was interesting, but really pretty sub-par, I stayed here with my mum and sister, we wanted somewhere affordable in LA which it certainly was. It felt dirty (like most of LA) though and we were glad to leave. The hotel bar is nice, but really this place suits teenagers and backpackers. Also the room was so noisy! It's in a pretty unsafe part of town and we didn't feel safe walking around nearby, but interestingly while we were there a film crew was shooting some scenes right outside, and later they (and the hotel) showed up in Collateral. How very LA.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Place to spend a Summer Weekend”
Reviews.Author: sigridegan
Reviews.Content: The rating for this very unique property is difficult. Although I rated it neutral/average I have to add that I have stayed at that hotel many many times. I booked my tour groups there for probably 10 years and the Germans loved it, but so do my small groups< Americans from Arizona, that I have brought there in 2005 and 2006 and we are planning on going again this summer. To have this very unusually decorated place with a lush garden and swimmingpool in the downtown L.A. area is the best. It is not that we are not used to deluxe hotels but a lot of them are just too plastic, no personality. I have never had problems. The owner Uno has also run his own hotel all this time and is an extremely reliable person to work with. If guests have sometimes a problem with an employee, so do other hotels, the turn-over in this business is tremendous. Put in a complaint so problems can be dealt with. Sigrid Egan, Scottsdale, Arizona

Reviews.Title: “It is certainly different!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PCPG
Reviews.Content: I must agree with a previous review about the staff being rude. My Husband and I were sitting havinf a drink with some friends in the bar, which is at the back of the hotel near the pool. A Wedding was taking place in a function room some distance away in the centre of the hotel. We were not making excessive noise but the Manager shouted at us to stop talking because of the Wedding. Even if we had been shouting the noise could not have reached the room where the ceremony was taking place. The Hotel is extremely dark, a torch could be very useful, the bedrooms basic with concrete floors and chicken wire covering the dirty windows. Also, even worse, 5 of our party, including myself received bites whilst in bed - and they were not from our partners!!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2go
Reviews.Content: My cousin got married here in Oct. and based on the reviews, I was expecting a dive. I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very modest, but clean and functional. Window AC units and limited cable, but good beds and a small refrigerator in each room. There were plenty of restaurants and 2 Macy's within a 15 minute walk. Breakfast was basic staples ala carte - but fine. The wedding food was Greek/Moroccan and really good! The wedding was candlelit and quite beautiful. Location is great and hotel price is relatively cheap for downtown LA. The manager was very professional and helpful, not rude at all!

Reviews.Title: “full of character and charm”
Reviews.Author: JenniOSF
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Figueroa whenever I am in LA. It is truly charming and each room has a sense of character unlike the sterile tedium of your average regular hotel. The bar is always full of interesting people, the staff if friendly and helpful and with fellow guests from all over the world flocking to the Figueroa one is always filled with a sense of LA as a world destination.

Reviews.Title: “Results May Vary, Depending on Your Room!”
Reviews.Author: stvnptrk66
Reviews.Content: I live in Los Angeles, but was stationed at the Figueroa for a recent convention. (Funnily enough, I think this is the first LA hotel I've stayed in!) I'm amazed by the spectrum of reviews this place received on this site and have to say I think your reaction depends on the room you get. Mine had satisfactory lighting, decent TV, a handy fridge & cabinet, and modest but clean indoor/outdoor carpet. (Some feature concrete or hardwood.) Bed was excellent and A/C was effective. Closets a little shabby and/or creepy, but I had two of them and they were both huge! I'll echo some other reviewers whose comments are instructive: Bring your own alarm clock. Watch out for slippery, slow-draining bathtubs. Toiletries nothing special-just soap and shampoo. Ear plugs a good idea; the area is constantly under construction. The place is quirky and charming; you'll get a kick if you're young, in love, or just enjoy the "Moroccan" vibe. Bar and pool are fantastic. Surrounding urban area closes early but not the horrible war zone some travelers describe. Get familiar with downtown LA beforehand, learn to use the subways (just 3 blocks away) and explore a unique hotel in a rapidly developing neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in 50 years of travel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband had an event at the convention center, and we thought it would be good to have the convenience of the proximity of this hotel. We both agree, it would have been far better to find another hotel and rent a car or take a taxi than to experience the treatment of the management and the discomfort of this hotel, even for one night. This was by far my very worst hotel experience ever, from the moment we arrived at the front entrance. The dark, dreary lobby was an immediate turn-off...very depressing. After entering our room, and taking a look around, I immediately wanted to leave. The room was entirely (walls and ceiling) painted a dark red color. Very poor lighting. Not even the minimum amenities. The toilet seat had no cover, but the worst part was the toilet itself. If it was clean, you couldn't tell. It was horribly stained black, and was actually broken in the bottom. The bathtub was rusted. The towels were threadbare. The carpet looked like the original carpet from 1900. Window a/c that didn't allow the curtain to close. Upon awakening the next morning, I found a roach in my shoe. When walking through the path to the parking lot, we were attacked by swarms of flying insects. I was treated with extreme rudeness and disrespect by the manager/owner when I attempted to have a conversation with him about some of our complaints. There was no attempt to resolve anything, and he insulted me time and time again. I was absolutely flabbergasted at the things he said to me. We only stayed one night and checked out two days early. I only wish we had come to this site and read the reviews before we booked our stay. This experience was the only blight on an otherwise delightful trip to the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived and thought it was a beautiful setting. Got to my room and realized I'd paid for Motel 6!! Bare rooms with absolutely no amenities. I arrived late in the evening so decided to go down and grab a bite to eat. The cafeteria style restaurant was closed, when I asked the Manager about it - he grabbed me by the arm, walked me to the front door and said- to look elsewhere for food because the restaurant is closed. I've never experienced that kind of rudeness before. Not only was the manager completely insulting and rude- he invaded my personal space. Don't go to this place if you value your safety and sanity!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was less than appropriate. The rooms only had single beds, so spouses have to sleep separately!! No Cable TV. Manager was really rude when tryng to resolve an issue. Fire alarms in the room we were in was covered with plastic, so if there was a fire we probably would have died!! Not up to ADA standards.

Reviews.Title: “take a flashlight with you!”
Reviews.Author: griseldis
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the figueroa hotel l.a. in feb. this year with a group. i found the hotel a bit special. first, the hotel is very! dark. the lobby and the dining rooms are so dark that you can hardly see what you step on not to mention what is on your plate. so are the rooms. a had a single room that was very tiny, everything appeared to me a bit scruffy, maybe because of the darkness, you could not have seen any dirt (if there was any), i don't like that. the toilet had no cover, so it was always "open", i don't like that either. when i went out and met some l.a. guys they asked me where i lived and i answered "the figueroa" they started laughing and said, they would bring me a flashlight! the hotel is all decorated and styled in some kind of ethnic, i´d say arabic-turkish-mexican style. we had breakfast and dinner in the hotel as well and that was ok, neither real good nor real bad. regarding the staff i can not say anything negative, i had no fights with anybody. anyhow, i would not book the hotel myself (it was included in the tour package) because i want to see clearly where i live and what i eat.

Reviews.Title: “Figueroa - Terrible Owner”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would dissuade everyone from staying at this hotel. Your reservations will not be secure, as the owner has a complete disregard for client service. To make matters worse, while you attempt to discuss why your reservations have be dishonored, you will have to put up with a great deal of attitude. I advise you to seek out other reservations.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: ljnative
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night (3/30) on a business trip to LA. The moroccan lobby decor and pool bar are very nice. I didn't have any problems with the front desk staff -I asked for a different room after looking at the one I was assigned (it had two separate areas for the shower/toilet and sink/vanity) and they gave me one right away. I did see room for improvements though. They are missing some basic amenities that would really make the stay a lot more pleasant. They have no one available to either open the door or help with luggage, no alarm clocks in the rooms, no robes, towels, linens and toiletries are poor quality and they have about ten channels of basic cable on the tv. No coffee maker in the room - but there is a small fridge. They have a very limited menu in their "cafe" - choice of a burger, fried chicken or chicken salad, and there aren't a lot of options in the area either. It's not in the best neighborhood. There is a lot of street noise - the hotel is right next to the 110 fwy, and near a busy intersection. The floors are bare concrete, so no sound is muffled - I did not hear noise from other rooms though. Overall, they've done a fairly good job of renovating the place - the decor is charming, especially in the pool area - but they need to bring the service and amenities up to speed. I'd even pay a few dollars more for a more pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Figueroa Hotel and were really looking forward to it. Sadly, we have to enthusiastically concur with other reviewers who called the staff rude. For us, it was mostly the owner, an older French man--I won't say gentleman--who actually threw two of our friends out of the hotel for playing the piano. The friend who played is a trained jazz pianist and very talented. Other guests were sitting around, clapping, and really enjoying it when this French man stormed over to him. He called him and our other friend names and swore at them. They left, but only after he grabbed our friend's tie and called him an idiot. He was physically and verbally abusive to our friend who is a very kind and reasonable person. We were shocked and confused, but didn't have the whole story, so we reserved judgement. We didn't understand what had happened and after our two friends left the hotel, my husband approached him to find out. The owner, flanked by two large Mexican bell boys, pushed my husband and poked him in the chest three times, saying, "I want you, your wife, and your baby out of my hotel." My husband was so stunned that he agreed to leave. We got our money back and packed up. It was nearly midnight and raining outside. We drove home (we live in LA, thank God) in the rain with our seven month old baby screaming and crying. It was truly a nightmare. I would advise anyone against staying here, or even coming for a drink. This type of behavior should not be supported.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, rude , rude, rude, Rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It doesn't matter that the hotel was a fair value in terms of price, as anything moderately positive I might be able to say about the place is overshadowed by the fact that the staff and service was among the worst in the industry. I actually left and found another place to stay for this reason alone. They remind me of the Seinfeld episode of the Soup Nazi- they provide a fairly decent price in trems of comparible hotels which brings people back inspit of the fact that you are treated as if you owe them a HUGE favore. I will never stay here again regardless of how good the "soup" might be. If you don't care about service or don't mind being treated terribly or encountering an extremely rude staff regardless of the fact that you are paying them, then by all means, stay and enjoy the moderately decent establishment. I have a lot of people ask me for hotel recommendations as I stay in many city hotels for work. I can not, unfortunately recommentd this place to any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, most rooms pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: roninseattle
Reviews.Content: Rude is too nice a word for this place. Their b.o. has attitude! Notice they don't list their prices on their web site, and that maybe one or two rooms look are nice.

Reviews.Title: “a really good budget option”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a really great budget hotel. The common areas (lobby, pool, bar etc) are really inviting and relaxing (and I got good service from the front desk). My room was small, but with a huge bathroom; my friend (who had checked in earlier the same day) got a fantastic room, with a little dressing room and large bathroom. My room was fairly basic, and no frills; but it was clean and everything worked and the bed was fine. It is a really good hotel for its price (it's recommended by the Time Out guide). There is a restuarant in the lobby that serves a great, cheap breakfast buffet; eggs and pancakes and juice and sausages etc. I also had dinner (again good basic, decently priced food). I needed to be close to the Staples Center, and it is a 3 minute walk to there (and a three minute walk to the 7th Street/Metro subway stop).
