And also I got to see how great downtown LA is, and could eat at swanky places like the Standard, without having fork out big money for their rooms. I would definitely stay in the Figueroa again!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing departure from cookie-cutter hotels (ie. Omni)”
Reviews.Author: bwang8
Reviews.Content: After being totally disappointed with the Omni Downtown (overpriced, bland/tasteless room, distant from the convention center, ridiculous $24/night parking), my friends and i found welcomed refuge at the Figueroa for the rest of our stay. Taking a recommendation from my friend's LA guide book, we called the Figueroa and booked the last room available. The visually-stimulating, full-of-character Moorish-themed Figueroa made us feel that we were far from the concrete confines of downtown LA. We found the staff courteous and helpful, the room cozy (not small) with comfortable furnishings. A window unit A/C was adequate and the room was cleaned daily- even had a larger than usual mini-fridge. The pool was beautiful, great for basking in the sun and reading near the water. And, you can't beat the proxmity to the convention center, just a few blocks away. Didn't try the food, but the dining area always seem to have business. One of the best parts, 8 dollar parking each day with unlimited in and out. Save your money, relax and have more fun at a cool boutique-type hotel without all the fluff. Rustic doesn't mean low quality.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest Staff ever”
Reviews.Author: KristenB
Reviews.Content: I have never encountered more rude staff in all my travels. Too long of a story to go into, but the rudeness left my boyfriend and I speechless and bitter taste in our mouths for an otherwise lovely hotel. Beautiful pool bar. But for the sake of the hotel, please get rid of the lady at the front desk that "handles all hotel reservations." I am not sure where someone in the hospitaility business learned it was okay to be rude beyond belief. And I am glad to see that other postings have pointed out this fault as well. I hope the general manager will finally do something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: samoanfan
Reviews.Content: With all the complaints on here about how rude the staff is, you'd think they'd make a change. No such luck. After a lovely stay at the Biltmore we decided to stop by the Figueroa to see the rooms, and check out the bar since we'd heard so much about it and we stay downtown a lot. We were both dressed up (again we'd just come from the much nicer and more upscale Biltmore) and in great moods. I asked if the rest. was open- no not until 4pm- then I asked if we could see a guest room, but the rude lady at the desk said they were sold out (I find it a little difficult to believe that every room had a guest literally checked in to it, it was 1:30pm Sat the 8th of Oct.- I buy that all the rooms were reserved but surely we could've seen one that wasn't checked into yet). Then my husband asked where the restroom is, and to our HORROR, the rude lady at the desk told him there were "no public restrooms". I said, "perhaps you don't understand, we're here specifically to look at your hotel because we want to stay here in the future" and the rude lady at the desk STILL SAID NO!!! I had JUST asked her if the rest. was open and to tour one of the rooms!!! Obviously I was interested in more than a free flush of what must be some pretty spectacular toilets if she has to protect them like that. Literally, I wanted to say "well I never!" Especially coming from the Biltmore where the customer service level is so high. Just say no to this place, those jerks can be jerks to travelers who don't know any better but I'm telling EVERYONE I know not to patronize the Figueroa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Moorish setting.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only a few nights, but it will leave a fond memory of LA. The hotel was a feast for the eyes. My room was both elegant and comfortable - something proud to entertain, or tempting to just laze about in. The ground floor lobby, restaurant/cafe and pool/bar were of good presentation and quality. I would definately stay here again. Well placed in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Got2go2win
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to say that just walking into the front door completly sends your inhibitions to a distent land.The ombiance is totally Casablanca. To imagine yourself casted away in some foreign distant land with all the creatue comforts is like a snapping your fingers and boom your there. The corridor is a sight to see. The feel is remarkable. Fine detail is paid attention to the walls and the murials to give th soft comfortable feeling of escape to another land all the while knowing Los Angeles is only 20 feet away. The courtyard is like a world within a world . A cozy bar with all the popular libation choices. I had a Grey Goose martini streight up,$10.00 with tip. The rear has a pool where you can stroll,sit,relax and enjoy the comforts.The inside lounge has a Persian style bed that you can relax on and sip your drink on. Also some lounge chairs and tables and complementry chips and dip. The room was beautifull. Decorated with African motifs and Moroccon wall decorations and a spotless bathroom. Food is just your basic burger selection but there is the city that awaits your dining pleasure. Johnny g

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at this different hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellaire1
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is not your everyday Westin, Hyatt, or other big name hotel chain, but it is a pretty cool place. The unusually decorated lobby is very nice, the bar & pool area surrounded by vegetation create a very nice atmosphere for an evening drink. We spent an entire week at this hotel and never had cause to complain. When we were given our room we found it had 2 doubles, not the king we requested, within seconds the staff fixed that and we were in a gorgeously decorated old world style room that was actually as big as a suite. Now its not the most modern place in town, still has window ac units, no fancy tubs or bathrooms, but the theme decoration of the room was very nice, the bed comfortable, and the housekeeping service was excellent. Hard to define this hotel...eclectic, moraccon styled, old fashioned? but hey we enjoyed it! In fact everyday we came back to the room the windows were open with a cool breeze coming thru, havent stayed in a hotel in a long time where you could even open a window. Staples Center was just a block away, the convention center another block, very convenient for conference attendees. If you would like to try something different, stay here, if you want to do the "same ol thing" and stay at your typical 4/5 star hotel, go elsewhere. Sometimes different is good, less amenities, but we could appreciate the atmosphere. Likely not all would. A good hotel for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Appauling Customer Serive... what a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The manager, Uno was quite rude and condesending. The rate we were quoted was NOT a discount ($99 per night) as told for guests of "the bride and groom wedding party". This is the rate that quote any John Doe that calls in. They should not have told the wedding planners that they are giving their guest a discounted rate if they do not actually do this. The wedding itself was lovely, but had NOTHIN to do witht he hotel - it was how we decorated. Save yourself some headaches and rude treatment and stay accross the street at the Holiday Inn. We've been there previously for a business convestion. Rates are the same, but the serivce is wonderful and the beds by far much more comfotable. Also, the Fig Mhotel was very dark - including the poor light in the rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Figueroa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 939 South Figueroa Street, Los Angeles, CA 90015
